description:
The Salesforce Certified Administrator credential is designed for those who have experience as a Salesforce Administrator. Candidates should possess broad knowledge of Salesforce applications, regularly configure and manage Salesforce, and continuously look for ways their companies can get even more from additional features and capabilities.

Here are some examples of the concepts you should understand to pass the exam:

Manage users, data, and security
Maintain and customize Sales Cloud and Service Cloud applications
Build reports, dashboards, and workflows

episodes.title: Overview
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.025 --> 00:00:06.168
[SOUND] Hello, I'm Mike Roderick and I'm
excited to announce that we're starting

2
00:00:06.168 --> 00:00:11.975
a brand new series here at ITPRO.TV,
Salesforce Certified Administrator.

3
00:00:11.975 --> 00:00:16.697
And joining us here in the studios is
subject matter expert Felicia Duarte,

4
00:00:16.697 --> 00:00:19.410
she's the COO at Cloud Creations.

5
00:00:19.410 --> 00:00:22.330
She's gonna tell us a little bit
more about what we can expect

6
00:00:22.330 --> 00:00:23.870
in the following series of videos.

7
00:00:25.440 --> 00:00:26.200
>> Yes.

8
00:00:26.200 --> 00:00:31.830
These episodes are targeted to
individuals with Salesforce knowledge,

9
00:00:31.830 --> 00:00:35.740
experience as a Salesforce admin, and
anyone with broad knowledge of Salesforce.

10
00:00:35.740 --> 00:00:39.370
This is the first step,
this is the baseline certification

11
00:00:39.370 --> 00:00:43.320
that you can have as
a Salesforce Certified admin.

12
00:00:43.320 --> 00:00:45.940
In these episodes,
I'm gonna go through best practices.

13
00:00:45.940 --> 00:00:51.720
I'm gonna go through each section on
how to complete and pass the exam.

14
00:00:51.720 --> 00:00:53.680
The exam is 60 questions.

15
00:00:53.680 --> 00:00:58.350
You need at least a 65% passing
score in order to pass and

16
00:00:58.350 --> 00:01:01.180
be a Certified Salesforce admin

17
00:01:01.180 --> 00:01:04.020
in order to get to the next step
in your certification journey.

18
00:01:04.020 --> 00:01:06.680
Some of the topics that
I'm gonna go over and

19
00:01:06.680 --> 00:01:10.800
include would be the user setup,
accounts and contacts,

20
00:01:10.800 --> 00:01:15.950
custom objects, standard objects setup,
reports and analytics.

21
00:01:15.950 --> 00:01:21.240
Some smaller things like Salesforce One
setup, the app exchange.

22
00:01:21.240 --> 00:01:25.550
All of these questions are going
to be asked on the test.

23
00:01:25.550 --> 00:01:30.740
I provide some sample questions that you
might see, give some recommendations on

24
00:01:30.740 --> 00:01:36.240
how to pass the test and how to do
some of those work flow automations,

25
00:01:36.240 --> 00:01:42.658
how to build reports, how to do some of
the features that you'll see on this exam.

26
00:01:42.658 --> 00:01:44.969
[NOISE]

episodes.description: In this episode, Felicia and Mike Discuss the Salesforce Certified Administrator exam. They go over the exam objectives, and how to prepare for the exam.
episodes.title: Introduction to Salesforce Administrator
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.270 --> 00:00:01.306
Welcome to ITProTV.

2
00:00:01.306 --> 00:00:02.676
I'm your host Don Pezet.

3
00:00:02.676 --> 00:00:05.575
[CROSSTALK]
>> Live from San Francisco.

4
00:00:05.575 --> 00:00:10.907
[CROSSTALK]
>> You're watching ITPro.TV.

5
00:00:10.907 --> 00:00:12.768
[MUSIC]

6
00:00:12.768 --> 00:00:15.582
>> Hello, welcome to another
exciting episode here at ITPro.TV.

7
00:00:15.582 --> 00:00:17.248
I'm your host, Mike Rodrick, and

8
00:00:17.248 --> 00:00:20.203
today we're doing our
Salesforce Certified Administrator.

9
00:00:20.203 --> 00:00:22.334
And in particular in this episode,

10
00:00:22.334 --> 00:00:27.580
we're gonna be doing an introduction
to the Salesforce Administrator Exam.

11
00:00:27.580 --> 00:00:29.874
And here to help us with that is Ms.
Felicia Duarte.

12
00:00:29.874 --> 00:00:36.390
She is a COO at Cloud Creations who is
an implementation partner with Salesforce.

13
00:00:36.390 --> 00:00:37.740
Welcome Felicia, how are you doing?

14
00:00:37.740 --> 00:00:38.788
>> Great, thanks for having me.

15
00:00:38.788 --> 00:00:42.735
>> Great to have you here and yeah, so
Felicia tell me a little bit more about

16
00:00:42.735 --> 00:00:45.402
what I can expect if I wanna sign up for
this exam?

17
00:00:45.402 --> 00:00:51.087
>> Yup, and that's my goal here today is
to teach everyone how to take the exam and

18
00:00:51.087 --> 00:00:52.218
pass the exam.

19
00:00:52.218 --> 00:00:53.825
>> Yes, very important.

20
00:00:53.825 --> 00:00:55.011
[LAUGH].
>> So the who, the what,

21
00:00:55.011 --> 00:00:55.729
the when, the where.

22
00:00:55.729 --> 00:00:57.357
[LAUGH] That's the objective for
today, so.

23
00:00:57.357 --> 00:00:58.919
>> Fantastic, all right,
so where do we start?

24
00:00:58.919 --> 00:01:03.050
I guess the first thing we need to know is
who should be looking at taking this exam?

25
00:01:03.050 --> 00:01:03.631
>> Right, and good question.

26
00:01:03.631 --> 00:01:06.520
So anyone who is a current
Salesforce admin,

27
00:01:06.520 --> 00:01:11.070
any consulting partners,
anyone who wants to be a system admin.

28
00:01:11.070 --> 00:01:14.102
I would say anyone with a broad
knowledge of Salesforce.

29
00:01:14.102 --> 00:01:18.295
To start this is kind of your stepping
stone into the certifications that

30
00:01:18.295 --> 00:01:19.816
Salesforce has to offer.

31
00:01:19.816 --> 00:01:24.590
So there are no pre-requisites for
this exam itself.

32
00:01:24.590 --> 00:01:28.250
But if you want an advance
the longest administrative track,

33
00:01:28.250 --> 00:01:29.830
this is the first certification.

34
00:01:30.920 --> 00:01:31.976
And the why, the benefits?

35
00:01:31.976 --> 00:01:36.941
There are few benefits aside from
receiving a badge that goes with it.

36
00:01:36.941 --> 00:01:38.659
It's a great resume builder, but

37
00:01:38.659 --> 00:01:41.277
it definitely shows your
knowledge of Salesforce.

38
00:01:41.277 --> 00:01:46.206
Cuz I will say anyone who has
already attempted to take the exam,

39
00:01:46.206 --> 00:01:47.945
it is not an easy exam.

40
00:01:47.945 --> 00:01:49.522
>> [LAUGH]
>> So, and

41
00:01:49.522 --> 00:01:52.383
that's what I wanna kinda help
everyone here prepare for it.

42
00:01:52.383 --> 00:01:55.221
And anyone taking it for the first time,

43
00:01:55.221 --> 00:02:00.244
I think it's important to know some
things to be ready to take the exam.

44
00:02:00.244 --> 00:02:05.943
So where, might be a good example or
good question.

45
00:02:05.943 --> 00:02:07.864
[LAUGH]
>> [LAUGH] The where?

46
00:02:07.864 --> 00:02:10.020
There's three different
ways to take the test.

47
00:02:10.020 --> 00:02:13.422
So one of them being
an online proctored exam.

48
00:02:13.422 --> 00:02:15.834
So you can certainly take it from home,
but

49
00:02:15.834 --> 00:02:19.392
there are definitely some
requirements that Salesforce has.

50
00:02:19.392 --> 00:02:23.606
So they use the criterion
centennial software, so

51
00:02:23.606 --> 00:02:28.018
you cannot use my laptop,
it's a built-in camera.

52
00:02:28.018 --> 00:02:31.730
You do need a web stand alone camera.

53
00:02:31.730 --> 00:02:35.720
And with that, it needs at least
12 inches of visibility, so

54
00:02:35.720 --> 00:02:38.550
they need to be able to see your keyboard,
your hands.

55
00:02:38.550 --> 00:02:43.838
Make sure you do not have any
documentation or material, no breaks.

56
00:02:43.838 --> 00:02:48.594
It is viewed, so that's another
way to go ahead and take it, but

57
00:02:48.594 --> 00:02:52.486
there are some requirements
to do it in that aspect.

58
00:02:52.486 --> 00:02:55.447
And then the next one would
be of course going on site.

59
00:02:55.447 --> 00:02:59.712
So if you go to the website itself,
there's some options and places and

60
00:02:59.712 --> 00:03:04.280
locations nearby to take the test,
most of them are schools.

61
00:03:04.280 --> 00:03:09.032
I would suggest to prepare and schedule
it at least 24 to 72 hours before,

62
00:03:09.032 --> 00:03:12.410
if this is something you're
looking to do right away.

63
00:03:12.410 --> 00:03:15.562
But that's another alternative
that's where I did it.

64
00:03:15.562 --> 00:03:19.201
And you'll login to
the Salesforce website,

65
00:03:19.201 --> 00:03:24.809
web assessor to get started and
get yourself prepared to take the test.

66
00:03:24.809 --> 00:03:28.067
And then another option is
Salesforce has a lot of events.

67
00:03:28.067 --> 00:03:32.322
If you've already been working in the
system your familiar with Dreamforce or

68
00:03:32.322 --> 00:03:35.550
they have a lot of world tour or
events just to be certified.

69
00:03:35.550 --> 00:03:37.736
They do have some discounts there, but

70
00:03:37.736 --> 00:03:40.593
that's also another way in
place to take the test.

71
00:03:40.593 --> 00:03:45.486
So I would encourage to either do online
proctored or through a school this way,

72
00:03:45.486 --> 00:03:49.149
you can get it done and
not have to wait for the annual event.

73
00:03:49.149 --> 00:03:51.556
But if it comes near time,
I would wait around and

74
00:03:51.556 --> 00:03:53.508
then take advantage of any discounts.

75
00:03:53.508 --> 00:03:56.880
>> All right, so we get a few different
places we can look to take the exam.

76
00:03:56.880 --> 00:03:59.179
Felicia, tell me a little bit
more about the exam itself.

77
00:03:59.179 --> 00:04:04.562
>> Yes, so it is 60 multichoice questions,
some multiselect.

78
00:04:04.562 --> 00:04:07.728
And you have 90 minutes to take the test.

79
00:04:07.728 --> 00:04:12.194
You need at least a 65%
to pass the test and

80
00:04:12.194 --> 00:04:16.188
you need to maintain it when todo pass.

81
00:04:16.188 --> 00:04:20.630
So I wanna cover in this material,
what some of those questions are.

82
00:04:20.630 --> 00:04:25.084
Unfortunately, there are no exact
Salesforce questions that you can just

83
00:04:25.084 --> 00:04:29.548
pull from and use, so there's no live
content on the Salesforce website.

84
00:04:29.548 --> 00:04:33.016
But there are some places that host some
of these test exam questions to kinda quiz

85
00:04:33.016 --> 00:04:33.533
yourself.

86
00:04:33.533 --> 00:04:36.646
And find out where you're strong
in some areas and weak in others.

87
00:04:36.646 --> 00:04:41.317
But just fee cost, so registration
is $200 and then to maintain or

88
00:04:41.317 --> 00:04:43.150
retake test is a $100.

89
00:04:43.150 --> 00:04:47.591
There are discounts again like I mentioned
during Salesforce events like Dreamforce.

90
00:04:47.591 --> 00:04:51.478
For anyone who needs to use it
in any different languages,

91
00:04:51.478 --> 00:04:54.901
they offer it in six
different languages options.

92
00:04:54.901 --> 00:04:57.458
>> Very good, all right,
then once we take the exam,

93
00:04:57.458 --> 00:04:59.126
let's say we take it and pass it.

94
00:04:59.126 --> 00:05:00.991
Is this a lifetime certification, or

95
00:05:00.991 --> 00:05:04.210
is this something that we're gonna
need to re-up now and again?

96
00:05:04.210 --> 00:05:05.831
>> Yeah, and that's a great question.

97
00:05:05.831 --> 00:05:09.758
So you do need to maintain your
credentials and there are exams,

98
00:05:09.758 --> 00:05:14.090
maintenance exams that you need to take,
it depends on the license.

99
00:05:14.090 --> 00:05:17.786
For this specific one or
credential that you're gonna be taking,

100
00:05:17.786 --> 00:05:21.625
you need to maintain and take three
release exams on a year annually.

101
00:05:21.625 --> 00:05:26.213
So those exams, Salesforce is three
releases dates, they do in Spring,

102
00:05:26.213 --> 00:05:30.880
Summer and Winter, and you have a time
period to take those release exams.

103
00:05:30.880 --> 00:05:35.669
It's not as intensive as the normal
intern exam, but there about five or

104
00:05:35.669 --> 00:05:38.431
ten multiple choice questions on those.

105
00:05:38.431 --> 00:05:43.606
You do need a passing of 30 minutes to
complete and you're permitted 3 attempts.

106
00:05:43.606 --> 00:05:46.345
And you can take it online,
it's not proctored.

107
00:05:46.345 --> 00:05:48.067
So there's a little bit leniency there.

108
00:05:48.067 --> 00:05:48.795
>> Nice.

109
00:05:48.795 --> 00:05:51.121
>> But
you do have to continue maintaining it.

110
00:05:51.121 --> 00:05:56.546
Otherwise, you could suspend this license,
you may have to redo the whole process.

111
00:05:56.546 --> 00:05:59.311
So something you do wanna look out for
and be aware of.

112
00:05:59.311 --> 00:06:02.612
>> Definitely wanna avoid
retaking the entire exam, right?

113
00:06:02.612 --> 00:06:03.203
>> Yeah.

114
00:06:03.203 --> 00:06:04.343
[LAUGH]
>> [LAUGH]

115
00:06:04.343 --> 00:06:05.063
>> Yes, yes.

116
00:06:05.063 --> 00:06:09.581
>> Right, so the exam itself then,
how do they break down the topics, or

117
00:06:09.581 --> 00:06:13.210
what is it that they're looking for
on the exam?

118
00:06:13.210 --> 00:06:15.130
>> Yes, so
something that I teach a lot of people,

119
00:06:15.130 --> 00:06:18.252
I think it's important to know the
breakdown and the percentage breakdown.

120
00:06:18.252 --> 00:06:21.337
This way you know Salesforce again is so
robust.

121
00:06:21.337 --> 00:06:26.210
Which areas you're strong in and
which areas you're weak in?

122
00:06:26.210 --> 00:06:27.961
And which areas to kind of
sell you more in if it has-

123
00:06:27.961 --> 00:06:28.733
>> [LAUGH]

124
00:06:28.733 --> 00:06:29.436
>> A heavier weight on percentages.

125
00:06:29.436 --> 00:06:34.210
So I'll go through that outline and
this way you know, hey, I'm not so

126
00:06:34.210 --> 00:06:35.650
strong in this area.

127
00:06:35.650 --> 00:06:38.690
Let me go back into this episode or
this content and kinda refresh and

128
00:06:38.690 --> 00:06:44.310
see what don't I know and
what do I feel pretty confident in.

129
00:06:44.310 --> 00:06:48.168
Another kind of tip that I like
to suggest when preparing and

130
00:06:48.168 --> 00:06:52.027
trying to take this test is go
through some test scenarios or

131
00:06:52.027 --> 00:06:56.053
test questions and
areas where you feel pretty confident on.

132
00:06:56.053 --> 00:07:00.023
Again go back to areas where you're
weak and this is where you know,

133
00:07:00.023 --> 00:07:04.355
let's say if you're in something
that 18% standard custom objects.

134
00:07:04.355 --> 00:07:09.034
If you master that you've got 18% down
that your pretty, pretty confident on.

135
00:07:09.034 --> 00:07:11.839
You're about 100% sure you're
gonna get 18% right, and

136
00:07:11.839 --> 00:07:13.460
let's jump to the next one you know.

137
00:07:13.460 --> 00:07:18.229
Security access 15%, it's kinda tuck
of bag, kind of work your way there.

138
00:07:18.229 --> 00:07:22.146
So I would like to go
through a breakdown maybe.

139
00:07:22.146 --> 00:07:23.001
>> Sure, that sounds great.

140
00:07:23.001 --> 00:07:28.082
>> Great, yep, a very small,
we have a 1% WAN as an organization setup.

141
00:07:28.082 --> 00:07:31.068
So that includes
the company profile setup,

142
00:07:31.068 --> 00:07:35.390
whether you're setting up the fiscal year,
the company hours,

143
00:07:35.390 --> 00:07:39.647
default settings,
currency management, that's a 1% WAN.

144
00:07:39.647 --> 00:07:42.560
That's where most of the company
profile information is held.

145
00:07:42.560 --> 00:07:46.310
Next after that, you have the user setup.

146
00:07:46.310 --> 00:07:50.679
So as a system admin, this is where
deactivating users, creating users.

147
00:07:50.679 --> 00:07:55.587
A most common scenario is that you kind
of do in your every day work to work as

148
00:07:55.587 --> 00:07:56.703
a system admin.

149
00:07:56.703 --> 00:08:01.433
Again 9%,
wait on the exam questions itself.

150
00:08:01.433 --> 00:08:05.626
So resolving lock accounts,
resetting passwords, and

151
00:08:05.626 --> 00:08:08.517
all this out covering in our episodes.

152
00:08:08.517 --> 00:08:12.894
Next, again smaller presentage,
global settings, so

153
00:08:12.894 --> 00:08:19.198
configuring page layouts, the UI, user
interface look and feel of Salesforce.

154
00:08:19.198 --> 00:08:22.753
List views, knowing just some of
those basic definitions that you use

155
00:08:22.753 --> 00:08:24.028
in your every day setup.

156
00:08:24.028 --> 00:08:27.712
But heavier weights, so security.

157
00:08:27.712 --> 00:08:31.795
Security is a big part in Salesforce,
it takes up to 15%

158
00:08:31.795 --> 00:08:32.515
>> Wow.

159
00:08:32.515 --> 00:08:34.298
>> Of the total weight of the questions.

160
00:08:34.298 --> 00:08:40.549
So you really do wanna know the security
setup, not just for the exam itself.

161
00:08:40.549 --> 00:08:45.189
But it's really the base of Salesforce and
what you can do in the system.

162
00:08:45.189 --> 00:08:49.446
And then next, what you utilize within?

163
00:08:49.446 --> 00:08:54.216
So the core Salesforce, your standard and
custom objects, your accounts, contacts,

164
00:08:54.216 --> 00:08:55.890
opportunities.

165
00:08:55.890 --> 00:08:59.894
This plays the largest
chunk into the exam, 19%.

166
00:08:59.894 --> 00:09:00.477
>> Wow.

167
00:09:00.477 --> 00:09:02.872
>> I'm sorry, 18%.

168
00:09:02.872 --> 00:09:05.721
[LAUGH] So you wanna make sure
you know your standard and

169
00:09:05.721 --> 00:09:08.008
custom objects, you know your security.

170
00:09:08.008 --> 00:09:11.875
You can kind of do the math there,
you got that,

171
00:09:11.875 --> 00:09:18.120
you have a pretty good chunk of
passing with your certification.

172
00:09:18.120 --> 00:09:21.490
And then next, you go down to sales and
marketing applications.

173
00:09:21.490 --> 00:09:27.040
So within the exam itself,
you're covering the sales cloud and

174
00:09:27.040 --> 00:09:31.610
the marketing cloud, and some of
the community cloud aspects into the exam.

175
00:09:31.610 --> 00:09:35.844
So this is gonna cover any of
the set up with the marketing

176
00:09:35.844 --> 00:09:40.262
applications opportunities,
products, price books,

177
00:09:40.262 --> 00:09:46.230
all those related questions will sit
within this kind of weight of questions.

178
00:09:46.230 --> 00:09:48.950
And then the next,
you would have service and support.

179
00:09:48.950 --> 00:09:53.603
So case management, case questions,
supports related information,

180
00:09:53.603 --> 00:09:55.061
that's 6% weight.

181
00:09:55.061 --> 00:09:58.557
And then some of the other
smaller ones that's so good

182
00:09:58.557 --> 00:10:01.801
to know because it can end up, would be-
>> [LAUGH]

183
00:10:01.801 --> 00:10:04.998
>> Activity management, chatter,

184
00:10:04.998 --> 00:10:09.848
data management, content and
folder management,

185
00:10:09.848 --> 00:10:13.630
and desktop and mobile counts for 2%.

186
00:10:13.630 --> 00:10:18.578
Somewhere in this larger chunk would be
workflow automation which is about 7%.

187
00:10:18.578 --> 00:10:22.049
And I think that covers that all.

188
00:10:22.049 --> 00:10:23.577
[LAUGH]
>> Fantastic.

189
00:10:23.577 --> 00:10:24.915
>> It could really dissected that.

190
00:10:24.915 --> 00:10:26.249
>> Very good, very good,

191
00:10:26.249 --> 00:10:29.869
it really does give us a good way
kind of focus our study, right?

192
00:10:29.869 --> 00:10:33.080
We wanna know it all,
we wanna be able to pass the exam.

193
00:10:33.080 --> 00:10:37.286
But Azure studying it really helps
to know, how much I should spend or

194
00:10:37.286 --> 00:10:40.201
focus on this versus one
of those other topics.

195
00:10:40.201 --> 00:10:43.743
So we thank you for that, what about
any other preparation materials?

196
00:10:43.743 --> 00:10:48.294
I know these episodes here at ITPro.TV
are obviously gonna help me pass the exam.

197
00:10:48.294 --> 00:10:50.213
Is there anything else I can
do to get ready for this?

198
00:10:50.213 --> 00:10:54.409
>> Yeah, I mean I would look at I don't
have any specific one to recommend, but

199
00:10:54.409 --> 00:10:57.504
I would look online through
some small practice exams.

200
00:10:57.504 --> 00:11:02.275
Again the questions, especially
the multiselect, they're pretty tricky.

201
00:11:02.275 --> 00:11:04.518
And I would quiz yourself and

202
00:11:04.518 --> 00:11:10.070
find there's a lot of places to go
to kinda pull from those exams.

203
00:11:10.070 --> 00:11:14.005
And use information that you got wrong
to kind of go read back and look and

204
00:11:14.005 --> 00:11:16.707
see I thought it was
supposed to be this way.

205
00:11:16.707 --> 00:11:21.663
But there's a small error in
the way they phrase their questions

206
00:11:21.663 --> 00:11:23.694
can kind of throw you off.

207
00:11:23.694 --> 00:11:28.555
And I've talked with people who've
been Salesforce admins for five,

208
00:11:28.555 --> 00:11:33.510
ten years and they took the test,
didn't prepare, didn't question.

209
00:11:33.510 --> 00:11:35.989
They thought they had it in the bag and
they failed.

210
00:11:35.989 --> 00:11:39.982
I mean Salesforce is so robust,
it's those small little things,

211
00:11:39.982 --> 00:11:42.416
it's the way they phrase the question.

212
00:11:42.416 --> 00:11:46.790
It's the multiselect options that
you think you know something.

213
00:11:46.790 --> 00:11:48.320
Or even the updates like I said,

214
00:11:48.320 --> 00:11:51.906
they did the three releases where those
answers change and things change.

215
00:11:51.906 --> 00:11:56.840
And if you're not up to date or
you don't prepare enough,

216
00:11:56.840 --> 00:12:00.165
you're gonna lose out those points and

217
00:12:00.165 --> 00:12:04.107
no one wants to pay to
have to take a retake fee.

218
00:12:04.107 --> 00:12:04.646
>> No.

219
00:12:04.646 --> 00:12:05.957
[LAUGH]
>> [LAUGH] Yep, so yes,

220
00:12:05.957 --> 00:12:07.764
my thing would be to go back,
reflect, look.

221
00:12:07.764 --> 00:12:10.766
And another thing that I would suggest and

222
00:12:10.766 --> 00:12:16.786
which I would like to show you on this how
to navigate within Salesforce Trailhead.

223
00:12:16.786 --> 00:12:22.640
And then let's go to my screen and I'll
kinda show you where within Salesforce.

224
00:12:22.640 --> 00:12:25.617
So if you're logged in already and
you go to Setup.

225
00:12:25.617 --> 00:12:28.690
If you're still kinda
learning the system and

226
00:12:28.690 --> 00:12:33.022
maybe you don't have as enough
knowledge as you thought you had,

227
00:12:33.022 --> 00:12:36.426
you can see here right here
is View Free Tutorials.

228
00:12:36.426 --> 00:12:39.127
But the Trailhead is more interactive.

229
00:12:39.127 --> 00:12:41.453
Actually I'm sorry, I'm gonna go to Help.

230
00:12:41.453 --> 00:12:45.779
And for some reason Help is always
the page that takes the longest to load.

231
00:12:45.779 --> 00:12:48.553
>> [LAUGH]
>> [LAUGH] In salesforce it really is, and

232
00:12:48.553 --> 00:12:49.491
as it loads here.

233
00:12:49.491 --> 00:12:52.646
You have a few options which are covered
later in the demo as far as helping.

234
00:12:52.646 --> 00:12:57.894
But success community is great now
that I see it here, to get answers and

235
00:12:57.894 --> 00:13:03.857
talk to other users and maybe tips, aside
from what I'll kind of give you today.

236
00:13:03.857 --> 00:13:07.919
[LAUGH] But right over here to
Trailhead is where you wanna go, and

237
00:13:07.919 --> 00:13:11.769
it's a guided learning path to
doing things in Salesforce.

238
00:13:11.769 --> 00:13:14.818
So if you weren't strong
in work flow automation and

239
00:13:14.818 --> 00:13:16.911
you wanna do some practice things.

240
00:13:16.911 --> 00:13:21.920
They'll have you set up a developer
account and that is what I'm in right now.

241
00:13:23.320 --> 00:13:29.720
And this gives you, it's free full force
license access to do all of these things.

242
00:13:29.720 --> 00:13:33.880
Even data loads, you create accounts and
contacts, play around with it.

243
00:13:33.880 --> 00:13:39.410
This is your test org here, and
Trailhead works together with it.

244
00:13:39.410 --> 00:13:43.740
And they give you Trailhead badges and
I know some Salesforce account executives

245
00:13:43.740 --> 00:13:47.900
who add those badges to
their LinkedIn profile.

246
00:13:47.900 --> 00:13:50.980
So it's something fun to collect too,
and they make it interactive.

247
00:13:50.980 --> 00:13:55.842
But it's also a great way to do
it yourself and figure out, hey,

248
00:13:55.842 --> 00:13:59.368
I couldn't do it because
I missed a step here.

249
00:13:59.368 --> 00:14:02.774
So I would take advantage of
using the Trailhead, it's free.

250
00:14:02.774 --> 00:14:08.066
Getting a developer addition to do
the steps itself is the way you

251
00:14:08.066 --> 00:14:13.075
know what kinda small little
error you're making in setup.

252
00:14:13.075 --> 00:14:15.038
So those are my recommendations.

253
00:14:15.038 --> 00:14:17.410
>> All right, Felicia.

254
00:14:17.410 --> 00:14:20.521
A lot of great information there about
what we can expect as we start to get

255
00:14:20.521 --> 00:14:21.441
ready for this exam.

256
00:14:21.441 --> 00:14:24.875
And once we finally take the plunge and
take the exam.

257
00:14:24.875 --> 00:14:25.860
So we appreciate that, we thank you.

258
00:14:25.860 --> 00:14:28.195
I hope everybody out
there enjoyed watching.

259
00:14:28.195 --> 00:14:29.522
Signing off for ITPro.TV.

260
00:14:29.522 --> 00:14:31.239
I've been your host, Mike Rodrick.

261
00:14:31.239 --> 00:14:32.637
>> I'm Felicia Duarte.

262
00:14:32.637 --> 00:14:33.837
>> And we'll see you next time.

263
00:14:33.837 --> 00:14:41.778
[MUSIC]

264
00:14:41.778 --> 00:14:43.235
>> Thank you for watching ITPro.TV.

episodes.description: In this episode, Felicia and Mike look at setting up an organization in Salesforce. They also cover the available options when configuring a company profile.
episodes.title: Organization Setup Company Profile
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.310 --> 00:00:05.015
Welcome to ITPROTV, I'm your host.

2
00:00:05.015 --> 00:00:08.311
>> [CROSSTALK].

3
00:00:08.311 --> 00:00:08.811
>> You're watching ITPROTV.

4
00:00:12.500 --> 00:00:13.050
>> Hello.

5
00:00:13.050 --> 00:00:15.590
Welcome to another exciting
episode here at ITPROTV.

6
00:00:15.590 --> 00:00:17.660
I'm your host Mike Rodrick and

7
00:00:17.660 --> 00:00:20.500
today we're doing our
Salesforce Certified Administrator.

8
00:00:20.500 --> 00:00:23.210
And particularly in this episode,
we're gonna be focusing in on

9
00:00:23.210 --> 00:00:27.370
organization set up and
working with your company profile.

10
00:00:27.370 --> 00:00:30.050
And here to help us with that is Ms.
Felicia Duarte.

11
00:00:30.050 --> 00:00:31.630
How are you doing Felicia?

12
00:00:31.630 --> 00:00:32.510
>> Good.
How are you doing?

13
00:00:32.510 --> 00:00:33.480
>> Doing great.
Thanks.

14
00:00:33.480 --> 00:00:35.790
>> Great.
Yep, so today I'd like to cover and

15
00:00:35.790 --> 00:00:40.775
start out with organization setup and
company profile information Information.

16
00:00:40.775 --> 00:00:44.345
So this is great for
those system admins who are getting

17
00:00:44.345 --> 00:00:48.555
just started with Salesforce licenses,
getting the organization set up.

18
00:00:48.555 --> 00:00:50.885
It's often used if you
need to make changes.

19
00:00:50.885 --> 00:00:51.825
You need to know where to go,

20
00:00:51.825 --> 00:00:55.720
where to navigate and
to make these org-wide changes.

21
00:00:55.720 --> 00:00:59.470
So I'm gonna kinda show you where to make
those changes, what they're used for.

22
00:00:59.470 --> 00:01:03.740
It only covers for 1% out of the questions
for your Salesforce exam, but

23
00:01:03.740 --> 00:01:06.800
it's still good to know so
you don't, every question counts.

24
00:01:06.800 --> 00:01:08.253
So you don't get those wrong.

25
00:01:08.253 --> 00:01:08.920
[LAUGH]
>> That's right.

26
00:01:08.920 --> 00:01:10.850
I'm gonna go ahead and
bank a few of them there if we can.

27
00:01:10.850 --> 00:01:12.300
>> Yeah, yeah, I agree.

28
00:01:12.300 --> 00:01:15.730
So I'm gonna show on my screen
where to navigate to make those

29
00:01:15.730 --> 00:01:16.930
changes to start out.

30
00:01:16.930 --> 00:01:20.750
It can be a little tricky, especially if
it's your first time navigating on to

31
00:01:20.750 --> 00:01:24.470
the subsection, but
you have two search bars in Salesforce.

32
00:01:24.470 --> 00:01:28.420
So if I hit set up, you're gonna wanna
do all your searching as admin if

33
00:01:28.420 --> 00:01:30.990
not already familiar within
this quick find search here.

34
00:01:30.990 --> 00:01:35.859
So I'm just gonna search company profile,
and it's gonna take

35
00:01:35.859 --> 00:01:40.830
me over to this section over here
which is mostly used for admins.

36
00:01:40.830 --> 00:01:46.417
So I'm gonna come over here, again only
those with system admin rights have

37
00:01:46.417 --> 00:01:52.286
access to see this search and setup area,
which is why we're taking this exam.

38
00:01:52.286 --> 00:01:57.750
[LAUGH] So we're gonna go ahead and
go into the edit feature.

39
00:01:57.750 --> 00:02:01.970
Just so I can show you at this point right
here what kinda changes can you make here?

40
00:02:01.970 --> 00:02:03.880
And it's pretty much laid out here for
you.

41
00:02:03.880 --> 00:02:07.600
So basic, if you wanna make
changes to your organization name.

42
00:02:07.600 --> 00:02:11.170
Any time there's a case that you
need to log with Salesforce.

43
00:02:11.170 --> 00:02:12.590
Who's a primary contact?

44
00:02:12.590 --> 00:02:16.230
So that's right now,
I'm the user, Felicia Duarte.

45
00:02:16.230 --> 00:02:19.780
This is a look up and
it's gonna show who to contact if

46
00:02:19.780 --> 00:02:23.760
there's any changes that need
to be made within Salesforce.

47
00:02:23.760 --> 00:02:26.710
So enter your contact information there,
address,

48
00:02:26.710 --> 00:02:30.660
what's the address for the company,
the organization as a whole?

49
00:02:30.660 --> 00:02:33.890
You can have this here,
I'll cover further,

50
00:02:33.890 --> 00:02:38.020
as far as locale settings
go to the individual level,

51
00:02:38.020 --> 00:02:42.620
because maybe you have the org and
your setup in multiple locations.

52
00:02:42.620 --> 00:02:44.120
What's the time zone setting there?

53
00:02:44.120 --> 00:02:46.810
How do I make those preferences?

54
00:02:46.810 --> 00:02:51.000
Right now, I'm strictly talking
about the org as a whole.

55
00:02:51.000 --> 00:02:52.590
So what's the default?

56
00:02:52.590 --> 00:02:54.840
English, for us right now, US.

57
00:02:54.840 --> 00:02:58.890
We're gonna keep it with English
as the default language.

58
00:02:58.890 --> 00:03:03.350
I, myself am from Los Angeles, I'm gonna
keep it with Pacific Standard time.

59
00:03:03.350 --> 00:03:08.220
But I will show you options,
you have every single option here,

60
00:03:08.220 --> 00:03:10.360
to change any default
settings that you need to.

61
00:03:10.360 --> 00:03:15.520
So, I'm gonna go down
to currency settings.

62
00:03:15.520 --> 00:03:18.908
Now, you can keep if you
are using just one currency.

63
00:03:18.908 --> 00:03:22.367
So most companies just use
the standard US currency, but

64
00:03:22.367 --> 00:03:27.260
maybe you are using it and you need
to keep track of multiple currencies.

65
00:03:27.260 --> 00:03:32.470
This affects any currency field,
and throughout the Salesforce org,

66
00:03:32.470 --> 00:03:37.290
so if you need to establish
multiple currencies,

67
00:03:37.290 --> 00:03:39.680
you're gonna need to log
in a case with Salesforce.

68
00:03:39.680 --> 00:03:41.930
They're gonna need to enable it for you.

69
00:03:41.930 --> 00:03:46.000
But, part of those first prompts that they
give you to setting that up, is they're

70
00:03:46.000 --> 00:03:51.880
gonna ask you to select the allow
support to activate multiple currencies.

71
00:03:51.880 --> 00:03:53.160
We'll get into how to log a case, and

72
00:03:53.160 --> 00:03:55.610
what information you're gonna
be asked to be provided.

73
00:03:55.610 --> 00:03:59.131
But just know that when you do need to
enable it for any of your orgs that you're

74
00:03:59.131 --> 00:04:02.343
setting up, you need to make sure
you're gonna check this box first.

75
00:04:02.343 --> 00:04:07.771
And if you highlight over this little i,
it'll kinda give you more details

76
00:04:07.771 --> 00:04:12.768
there but this is just that first step
to the process to enabling it and

77
00:04:12.768 --> 00:04:15.888
right now we won't see all those options.

78
00:04:15.888 --> 00:04:20.716
But you'll have the options as far as
what currencies, the conversion rates and

79
00:04:20.716 --> 00:04:24.906
everything, and all of that's gonna
be tied into this section here.

80
00:04:24.906 --> 00:04:28.464
So again we're right up over
into the company information.

81
00:04:28.464 --> 00:04:31.776
So again,
this is also the place if you wanna check,

82
00:04:31.776 --> 00:04:36.660
if you wanna receive any Salesforce
newsletters to be sent to you.

83
00:04:36.660 --> 00:04:40.260
You can see here it's pretty
straightforward, log in notifications.

84
00:04:40.260 --> 00:04:43.480
This is just your place to handle that and
take care of it.

85
00:04:44.530 --> 00:04:49.750
But the company profile Is
broken down into five sections.

86
00:04:49.750 --> 00:04:52.740
So company information,
at this point right here,

87
00:04:52.740 --> 00:04:58.030
as you're getting started,
this is what you have available to edit.

88
00:04:58.030 --> 00:04:59.500
But I'm gonna take a step back.

89
00:04:59.500 --> 00:05:01.900
I don't need to make changes let's say.

90
00:05:01.900 --> 00:05:07.170
You can see all this information here,
but to your

91
00:05:07.170 --> 00:05:12.450
right you have more availability as far as
what you have access to, to see and do.

92
00:05:12.450 --> 00:05:16.160
So as a system admin your role is often

93
00:05:16.160 --> 00:05:21.450
to set up users,
attach licenses to these users.

94
00:05:21.450 --> 00:05:23.510
But you need to know your license count.

95
00:05:23.510 --> 00:05:25.550
You need to know your data.

96
00:05:25.550 --> 00:05:29.264
Once you've maybe set up and
then some historical data imports,

97
00:05:29.264 --> 00:05:31.153
once you have a lot going in here,

98
00:05:31.153 --> 00:05:34.950
I've worked with a lot of accounts
that have reached their limit.

99
00:05:34.950 --> 00:05:36.650
And they didn't even
know they had a limit.

100
00:05:36.650 --> 00:05:37.360
>> Wow.
>> Yeah.

101
00:05:37.360 --> 00:05:39.870
>> [LAUGH]
>> So I mean, this is the spot to go and

102
00:05:39.870 --> 00:05:44.770
keep track of, maybe initially
how much data do I wanna push in?

103
00:05:44.770 --> 00:05:46.860
Are you really looking
to bring on an org and

104
00:05:46.860 --> 00:05:49.330
push in three years of historical data?

105
00:05:49.330 --> 00:05:51.730
Five years, and
then you're reaching that data limit.

106
00:05:51.730 --> 00:05:57.125
And this will show you that space that you
have available as you're bringing in and

107
00:05:57.125 --> 00:06:00.755
pushing in data or kind of working
throughout the years within Salesforce.

108
00:06:02.065 --> 00:06:07.645
And to that point if you do wanna keep all
that information, all that data I'd like

109
00:06:07.645 --> 00:06:13.455
to kinda go through what the data consists
of, what's counted, what's not counted.

110
00:06:13.455 --> 00:06:19.270
And where to go when you need to
purchase more data space and file space.

111
00:06:19.270 --> 00:06:20.468
But we'll get into that in a bit.

112
00:06:20.468 --> 00:06:24.330
I just kinda wanna show you here
what are your options at this

113
00:06:24.330 --> 00:06:26.690
organization detail section.

114
00:06:26.690 --> 00:06:28.530
So API request.

115
00:06:28.530 --> 00:06:33.070
You have a limitation as far as
how many calls you can make.

116
00:06:33.070 --> 00:06:34.870
This is based off your license type.

117
00:06:36.100 --> 00:06:42.450
So if you have a Professional Edition,
Developer Edition and Enterprise Edition,

118
00:06:42.450 --> 00:06:48.610
you're able to make about 15,000
calls per 24-hour period.

119
00:06:48.610 --> 00:06:53.580
You have a Performance Edition that
goes up to 15,000 calls you can

120
00:06:53.580 --> 00:06:59.370
make within that 24-hour period, so it
depends on the license type that you have.

121
00:06:59.370 --> 00:07:02.090
I will say there are exceptions at

122
00:07:02.090 --> 00:07:06.480
Salesforce we've had to
make [LAUGH] before.

123
00:07:06.480 --> 00:07:10.660
But you can log a case
where they can enable,

124
00:07:10.660 --> 00:07:14.640
I believe it's up to a week,
if you need to make additional calls.

125
00:07:14.640 --> 00:07:17.040
Let's say you're pushing
in historical data,

126
00:07:17.040 --> 00:07:20.800
I'll show you where to log a case and make
those changes and requests to Salesforce.

127
00:07:20.800 --> 00:07:22.760
>> So where you might not
normally have that many, but

128
00:07:22.760 --> 00:07:24.740
you get this peak period where
you're bringing in all the data.

129
00:07:24.740 --> 00:07:26.540
You need a few extras
just to finish that up?

130
00:07:26.540 --> 00:07:29.520
>> Yeah, and that usually, for
most orgs happens early on,

131
00:07:29.520 --> 00:07:33.165
when you're pushing in all that historical
data or you're doing an update.

132
00:07:33.165 --> 00:07:38.520
And retail counts, so you need them
both up to date data right away.

133
00:07:38.520 --> 00:07:43.307
You kinda need to make those extra calls,
especially if you're

134
00:07:43.307 --> 00:07:47.750
using third-party apps,
like Jitterbit to push in data.

135
00:07:47.750 --> 00:07:52.707
There's only so many you can make at
a time that you need to log a case and

136
00:07:52.707 --> 00:07:54.658
enable more temporarily.

137
00:07:54.658 --> 00:07:56.727
And that's without a cost but

138
00:07:56.727 --> 00:08:01.126
you can also purchase more if
you need something more ongoing.

139
00:08:01.126 --> 00:08:07.160
So this is also the place to show you
restricted logins, current month.

140
00:08:07.160 --> 00:08:09.288
And then your Salesforce org ID.

141
00:08:09.288 --> 00:08:11.982
So any time you're asked,
which you will be asked,

142
00:08:11.982 --> 00:08:17.332
any time you're looking to bring on
a new app, they'll ask for your org ID.

143
00:08:17.332 --> 00:08:20.960
Any time you're looking to log a case
they're gonna ask you for your org ID.

144
00:08:20.960 --> 00:08:26.640
This is the best place to find it here,
if not the only place in Salesforce.

145
00:08:26.640 --> 00:08:27.958
And then what edition are you on?

146
00:08:27.958 --> 00:08:32.560
So right now I'm in a free
developer edition account.

147
00:08:32.560 --> 00:08:34.770
But are you in professional?

148
00:08:34.770 --> 00:08:36.650
Is your org in enterprise?

149
00:08:36.650 --> 00:08:40.610
And that's something I like to find
out early on, as I'm setting up and

150
00:08:40.610 --> 00:08:44.772
implementing because each one has its
own restrictions on what you can do.

151
00:08:44.772 --> 00:08:49.613
So as a system admin, and you're making
recommendations out to your users,

152
