like to troubleshoot this.

268
00:16:28.462 --> 00:16:35.797
So you can go into the users and out of
the box, you see your list of users here.

269
00:16:35.797 --> 00:16:40.737
But if you log a case with Salesforce,
you can enable feature called

270
00:16:40.737 --> 00:16:45.480
Login Activation, and
those set it up for you the same day.

271
00:16:45.480 --> 00:16:48.070
And what that would do
is that will give you

272
00:16:48.070 --> 00:16:51.250
another link right here to
the right that will say Login.

273
00:16:51.250 --> 00:16:55.430
And only for system admins at
the user level at this page here,

274
00:16:55.430 --> 00:16:57.920
you'll be able to login to each user.

275
00:16:57.920 --> 00:16:59.492
And I would go in and

276
00:16:59.492 --> 00:17:04.912
check per role hierarchy base what
each person has access to see.

277
00:17:04.912 --> 00:17:10.079
And at this point, you'll be able to kind
of test and see in the role hierarchy

278
00:17:10.079 --> 00:17:15.823
that they're sitting in, in the sharing
roles, are they seeing the right records?

279
00:17:15.823 --> 00:17:20.740
A second way to troubleshoot
this would be the Sharing Roles.

280
00:17:20.740 --> 00:17:25.487
So if they had access into the role,
they'll see that share button.

281
00:17:25.487 --> 00:17:28.316
And then there's another link
there that will say why,

282
00:17:28.316 --> 00:17:30.131
why do I have access to seeing this?

283
00:17:30.131 --> 00:17:35.061
So that'll kind of show you and
tell you it's based off a hierarchy,

284
00:17:35.061 --> 00:17:38.721
it was shared with you
because the manual sharing.

285
00:17:38.721 --> 00:17:42.580
And it'll give you more details as
to why you can see that record.

286
00:17:42.580 --> 00:17:47.561
This way you can troubleshoot back and
see, okay, I need a lot of things

287
00:17:47.561 --> 00:17:52.808
down further here, or maybe I placed
them into the wrong hierarchy group.

288
00:17:52.808 --> 00:17:56.318
And then you wanna go back in,
go to your roles.

289
00:17:56.318 --> 00:18:03.490
And this is a job that's really helped
by system admin to have to take care of.

290
00:18:03.490 --> 00:18:08.580
And I'm going to set up roles and
I'm back here to the role hierarchy.

291
00:18:08.580 --> 00:18:12.133
And we don't have a whole lot of
users in the developer accounts,

292
00:18:12.133 --> 00:18:14.078
but you can see how they expand all.

293
00:18:14.078 --> 00:18:16.402
I can see the levels here.

294
00:18:16.402 --> 00:18:21.843
So I see at the top level, we have
the CEOs and CFOs set at the very top.

295
00:18:21.843 --> 00:18:25.830
And we see the way it's breaking
down in this kind of branching here.

296
00:18:25.830 --> 00:18:28.846
And we can at this point, if we had users,

297
00:18:28.846 --> 00:18:32.490
we would be able to say
who sits under here.

298
00:18:32.490 --> 00:18:36.156
And you can make changes to the roles and
it's real easy to move people around.

299
00:18:36.156 --> 00:18:40.812
But that's a great way to troubleshoot
any problems that you come across.

300
00:18:40.812 --> 00:18:44.860
>> Fantastic, really good look there about
how we can go about controlling access or

301
00:18:44.860 --> 00:18:46.927
securing access which is you mentioned.

302
00:18:46.927 --> 00:18:48.803
One is a big part of the exam, and two,

303
00:18:48.803 --> 00:18:51.813
I would think it's a big part
of your daily administration.

304
00:18:51.813 --> 00:18:56.650
And that is to control what access
your users have within Salesforce.

305
00:18:56.650 --> 00:18:57.880
We thank you for that Felicia.

306
00:18:57.880 --> 00:18:59.379
We hope everybody out there
enjoyed watching this one.

307
00:18:59.379 --> 00:19:02.739
Signing out for ITPro.TV,
I've been your host Mike Rodrick.

308
00:19:02.739 --> 00:19:04.037
>> Im Felicia Duarte.

309
00:19:04.037 --> 00:19:04.824
>> And we'll see you next time.

310
00:19:04.824 --> 00:19:12.692
[MUSIC]

311
00:19:12.692 --> 00:19:15.387
>> Thank you for wathcing ITPro.TV.

episodes.description: In this episode, Felicia and Mike demonstrate using profiles in Salesforce to control access. They look at the built-in profiles as well as ways to clone and modify profiles.
episodes.title: Security Access Part 2
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.006 --> 00:00:01.540
Welcome to ITProTV.

2
00:00:01.540 --> 00:00:07.228
[CROSSTALK]

3
00:00:07.228 --> 00:00:08.873
[MUSIC]

4
00:00:08.873 --> 00:00:10.503
You're watching ITProTV.

5
00:00:10.503 --> 00:00:15.104
>> Hello, welcome to another
exciting episode here at ITProTV.

6
00:00:15.104 --> 00:00:16.841
I'm your host Mike Rodrick, and

7
00:00:16.841 --> 00:00:20.230
today we're doing our
Salesforce Certified Administrator.

8
00:00:20.230 --> 00:00:23.970
And in this episode we're actually
continuing our thought process

9
00:00:23.970 --> 00:00:25.450
on security access.

10
00:00:25.450 --> 00:00:29.250
So part two, if you missed first part make
sure you go back and check that out and

11
00:00:29.250 --> 00:00:31.040
join us back here for part two.

12
00:00:31.040 --> 00:00:34.030
And here's to help us with all of these,
is Miss Felicia Duarte.

13
00:00:34.030 --> 00:00:35.270
How you're doing Felicia?

14
00:00:35.270 --> 00:00:36.620
>> Great thanks.

15
00:00:36.620 --> 00:00:41.040
So in our last episode we went
through what a user can see.

16
00:00:41.040 --> 00:00:42.680
Now we're gonna go through
what a user can do.

17
00:00:44.010 --> 00:00:47.230
So we're gonna discuss profiles and
permission sets.

18
00:00:47.230 --> 00:00:50.680
So all the accessibility that
a user can do within Salesforce,

19
00:00:50.680 --> 00:00:52.700
what controls do they have?

20
00:00:52.700 --> 00:00:58.020
What access do they have to make
changes within the Salesforce org?

21
00:00:58.020 --> 00:01:01.394
And with Salesforce,
within the Salesforce org.

22
00:01:01.394 --> 00:01:04.038
[LAUGH] So let's go into profiles.

23
00:01:07.485 --> 00:01:08.328
Let me navigate over

24
00:01:08.328 --> 00:01:18.679
here.

25
00:01:18.679 --> 00:01:22.480
Now, we have right here
choices of 36 profiles.

26
00:01:22.480 --> 00:01:25.110
But Salesforce, and
this goes off the licenses that you have.

27
00:01:25.110 --> 00:01:27.540
We're in a developer org so
I have more access.

28
00:01:27.540 --> 00:01:32.640
But you're really working with about
five different profiles to start with.

29
00:01:32.640 --> 00:01:34.120
We'll go through those options here.

30
00:01:34.120 --> 00:01:38.820
I'm gonna zoom in a little bit so
we can see here, and

31
00:01:38.820 --> 00:01:41.340
we see a list of all our profiles.

32
00:01:41.340 --> 00:01:46.790
Now profiles, typically
are determined by the job function.

33
00:01:46.790 --> 00:01:51.440
So you can only as a user,
you can have multiple profiles created.

34
00:01:51.440 --> 00:01:55.010
But you can per user only
be assigned one profile.

35
00:01:56.030 --> 00:02:00.120
So I've been into, as a system admin,
into different orgs, and

36
00:02:00.120 --> 00:02:03.180
I've seen hundreds of profiles created.

37
00:02:03.180 --> 00:02:08.355
And this is before permission
sets were built long ago.

38
00:02:08.355 --> 00:02:12.375
And you will just have the admin just
creating profiles and profiles for

39
00:02:12.375 --> 00:02:17.305
different users to kind of break down
the access for each different user or

40
00:02:17.305 --> 00:02:21.042
a group of users and it just gets,
it's too much sometimes.

41
00:02:21.042 --> 00:02:25.482
And that's why you have permission
sets to then give permission.

42
00:02:25.482 --> 00:02:28.132
But you wanna keep your profiles at

43
00:02:28.132 --> 00:02:32.852
a bare minimum as far as what you wanna
give them access to do within Salesforce.

44
00:02:34.032 --> 00:02:38.082
>> Are we usually making these profiles
then kind of based on maybe job role or

45
00:02:38.082 --> 00:02:40.252
level of access that a group
of people is gonna need?

46
00:02:40.252 --> 00:02:41.252
>> Yeah, exactly.

47
00:02:41.252 --> 00:02:45.940
And in the example of your role
system admin, you're system admin,

48
00:02:45.940 --> 00:02:48.040
you're administrator to
everything within Salesforce.

49
00:02:48.040 --> 00:02:54.030
But then you have your out-the-box
profile to be a standard user.

50
00:02:54.030 --> 00:02:58.010
And that's what most orgs start with.

51
00:02:58.010 --> 00:03:01.560
So we're gonna scroll all the way
to the bottom and let me zoom out,

52
00:03:01.560 --> 00:03:07.060
cuz right here it's called Standard User
and we have Standard Platform Users.

53
00:03:07.060 --> 00:03:10.844
And you can see to the right
the license that it pertains to.

54
00:03:10.844 --> 00:03:15.520
So we're working with and
discussing just Salesforce licenses.

55
00:03:15.520 --> 00:03:17.155
And so
if we go into Standard User profile here.

56
00:03:19.641 --> 00:03:23.204
I would start as you're
building out your profiles,

57
00:03:23.204 --> 00:03:26.380
think of the questions for
this group of users.

58
00:03:26.380 --> 00:03:31.100
Whoever you want to assign this profile
to, what tabs do I want them to see?

59
00:03:31.100 --> 00:03:35.630
What records as far as record
types should they have access to?

60
00:03:35.630 --> 00:03:40.020
The objects, we had discussed in some
earlier episodes that at the very top,

61
00:03:40.020 --> 00:03:45.150
as far as tabs go, yeah you can hide
them based off the app that you're in.

62
00:03:45.150 --> 00:03:48.140
But that doesn't necessarily mean
that you can't find shortcuts or

63
00:03:48.140 --> 00:03:51.440
different ways to navigate
to those objects.

64
00:03:51.440 --> 00:03:55.630
So at this point here, for the profile,
that's kind of where you hide things for

65
00:03:55.630 --> 00:03:59.140
what they can see in the object itself.

66
00:03:59.140 --> 00:04:03.160
So if you go down further,
what apps don't I want them to see?

67
00:04:03.160 --> 00:04:07.460
Maybe there are certain apps that you're
creating that are just for your sales

68
00:04:07.460 --> 00:04:12.140
users or just for your marketing users,
and you don't want them to have access to.

69
00:04:12.140 --> 00:04:17.310
Can utilize it and see, so there may be
objects created that are not meant for

70
00:04:17.310 --> 00:04:22.880
them to have access to even
a custom object like commissions.

71
00:04:22.880 --> 00:04:26.390
Maybe you don't want everyone to have
access to seeing this commission records

72
00:04:26.390 --> 00:04:27.780
or object details.

73
00:04:27.780 --> 00:04:30.930
So, you can restrict it at this page here.

74
00:04:30.930 --> 00:04:34.900
Now this Page Profile,
once you get into a profile page,

75
00:04:34.900 --> 00:04:37.290
a profile detail page, it's extensive.

76
00:04:37.290 --> 00:04:40.450
There's a lot of changes
you can make here.

77
00:04:40.450 --> 00:04:43.810
But I'll start out with a very high level,
what those settings are.

78
00:04:43.810 --> 00:04:46.290
And you know more or less where to go.

79
00:04:46.290 --> 00:04:49.820
A lot of questions on the exam
are gonna pertain to profiles.

80
00:04:49.820 --> 00:04:54.090
It's gonna ask you some tricky
multiple selection questions.

81
00:04:54.090 --> 00:04:57.800
An example of one is what
should a system admin

82
00:04:57.800 --> 00:05:00.160
do when they need to lock down app access?

83
00:05:00.160 --> 00:05:01.250
Where do they go?

84
00:05:01.250 --> 00:05:02.070
Is it record types?

85
00:05:02.070 --> 00:05:03.410
And this is where it starts getting

86
00:05:03.410 --> 00:05:08.129
challenging if you don't know
the difference between profiles and

87
00:05:08.129 --> 00:05:11.840
role hierarchies and
permission sets and sharing rules.

88
00:05:11.840 --> 00:05:16.510
All of these are combined in this
category on the exam itself.

89
00:05:16.510 --> 00:05:19.550
So, in that question,
where do you go when you want to restrict

90
00:05:19.550 --> 00:05:22.920
access to a third-party
app that was installed?

91
00:05:22.920 --> 00:05:24.400
You're not gonna go to the role hierarchy.

92
00:05:24.400 --> 00:05:28.040
That's just gonna show you
access to the records you're in.

93
00:05:28.040 --> 00:05:30.710
You're gonna go to the profile itself.

94
00:05:30.710 --> 00:05:35.900
And that's where you can open
up the access to those apps and

95
00:05:35.900 --> 00:05:38.340
everything you want them to see and
have access to.

96
00:05:38.340 --> 00:05:39.900
So we'll get down there in the bottom,

97
00:05:39.900 --> 00:05:44.090
but that's just an example of one of
the questions that are asked on the test.

98
00:05:44.090 --> 00:05:48.160
So here on the profile detail page,
you have the license you're in,

99
00:05:48.160 --> 00:05:52.620
basic name, created by, modified.

100
00:05:52.620 --> 00:05:56.020
But right now,
another point is we're in a standard user.

101
00:05:56.020 --> 00:06:00.050
So if I were to hit edit at this point,
just to this standard user

102
00:06:00.050 --> 00:06:04.780
profile that Salesforce gives you, there
aren't really any changes I can make.

103
00:06:06.970 --> 00:06:08.819
Aside from, let me x this out.

104
00:06:11.754 --> 00:06:16.051
Changing the defaults on some
of the custom app settings,

105
00:06:16.051 --> 00:06:17.810
the tab settings here.

106
00:06:17.810 --> 00:06:20.960
So you can change just at this
point from the standard user,

107
00:06:23.630 --> 00:06:26.130
the default on the tabs itself.

108
00:06:26.130 --> 00:06:26.970
This is just here.

109
00:06:26.970 --> 00:06:30.960
So not a whole lot of
customizations into any of these

110
00:06:30.960 --> 00:06:32.860
administrative permissions here.

111
00:06:32.860 --> 00:06:34.920
You can't make any changes.

112
00:06:34.920 --> 00:06:39.700
So what we like to do as we're setting
things up, that's about it as far as, and

113
00:06:39.700 --> 00:06:42.750
then these changes to the password policy.

114
00:06:42.750 --> 00:06:44.740
Those are the only changes you can make.

115
00:06:44.740 --> 00:06:50.180
But a lot of the requests that we need
to do live within these check boxes and

116
00:06:50.180 --> 00:06:51.520
these settings here.

117
00:06:51.520 --> 00:06:55.770
What I like to do is clone the profile,
so I am going to go back, or Cancel, and

118
00:06:55.770 --> 00:06:58.100
get back to the page we were on.

119
00:06:58.100 --> 00:06:59.200
And, I'm going to hit Clone.

120
00:07:00.210 --> 00:07:04.385
And usually,
let's say I work with Cloud Creations so

121
00:07:04.385 --> 00:07:08.030
I'm gonna use Cloud Creations
standard user.

122
00:07:08.030 --> 00:07:12.260
Usually I like to use a company name and
then just attach standard user at the end.

123
00:07:12.260 --> 00:07:14.990
This way I know what
profile I'm cloning from.

124
00:07:14.990 --> 00:07:15.990
And I'm gonna hit Save.

125
00:07:15.990 --> 00:07:20.270
And it's just gonna take all those same
requirements that a standard user has.

126
00:07:20.270 --> 00:07:25.230
And now that it's a custom profile,
and you can see that by the check box,

127
00:07:25.230 --> 00:07:28.560
now you can make changes to
all those other settings.

128
00:07:28.560 --> 00:07:32.480
You can add a description too,
as you start building profiles.

129
00:07:32.480 --> 00:07:36.140
And again best practice is you don't wanna
create numerous amounts of profiles,

130
00:07:36.140 --> 00:07:39.550
you wanna keep it at the minimum
level that you can, and

131
00:07:39.550 --> 00:07:42.460
then you open it up with permission sets.

132
00:07:42.460 --> 00:07:44.790
So, custom app settings.

133
00:07:44.790 --> 00:07:47.330
This is where you can check, for

134
00:07:47.330 --> 00:07:51.320
my standard user they shouldn't
have access to the call center.

135
00:07:51.320 --> 00:07:57.201
For my standard sales user, standard
marketing user standard support user.

136
00:07:57.201 --> 00:08:02.369
This is all part of the sales and
service cloud that is covered on the exam.

137
00:08:02.369 --> 00:08:05.413
So tab settings,
same thing that we saw earlier,

138
00:08:05.413 --> 00:08:08.830
is you can change your defaults to hidden,
off, or on.

139
00:08:09.830 --> 00:08:13.560
And you can see that you have
the level to change this for

140
00:08:13.560 --> 00:08:15.310
every object within Salesforce.

141
00:08:17.520 --> 00:08:20.080
And then, your administrative permissions.

142
00:08:20.080 --> 00:08:22.680
Now this can get real detailed here.

143
00:08:22.680 --> 00:08:26.280
Sometimes, as you can see,
there's too many fields on the page.

144
00:08:26.280 --> 00:08:28.190
Even I don't know sometimes
where to navigate, and

145
00:08:28.190 --> 00:08:33.100
my best guess is I control-F, or I find
it and search for what I'm looking for.

146
00:08:33.100 --> 00:08:39.050
And maybe it's a Salesforce 1, and
i'm trying to make changes there too.

147
00:08:39.050 --> 00:08:42.410
Sometimes, I just have to
use that to find it here.

148
00:08:42.410 --> 00:08:43.690
But just to give you a kind of example,

149
00:08:43.690 --> 00:08:46.510
some of the changes you can make,
because you can make changes to.

150
00:08:46.510 --> 00:08:52.200
Can this user create profiles,
I'm sorry, create reports or dashboards?

151
00:08:52.200 --> 00:08:56.430
Do they have the option
to manage CRM content?

152
00:08:56.430 --> 00:09:01.100
If you had a knowledge license,
can they manage Salesforce knowledge?

153
00:09:01.100 --> 00:09:03.950
Here's an example of
our security settings.

154
00:09:03.950 --> 00:09:07.390
Manage sharing, does this profile and

155
00:09:07.390 --> 00:09:12.870
everyone that's assigned this profile,
will they have access to managed sharing?

156
00:09:12.870 --> 00:09:17.610
And again, you can see the dashboard
folders, and report folders.

157
00:09:17.610 --> 00:09:20.650
This little help icon will
give you more details,

158
00:09:20.650 --> 00:09:23.030
if you're not sure exactly what it does.

159
00:09:23.030 --> 00:09:27.750
But as a system admin, I think it's
important to go and spend some time, and

160
00:09:27.750 --> 00:09:29.230
go into each one of these, and

161
00:09:29.230 --> 00:09:34.470
know what level of control you
can deal with in a profile.

162
00:09:34.470 --> 00:09:38.740
And this way, when you're asked of it,
or you have to make suggestions, or

163
00:09:38.740 --> 00:09:40.630
if you have to take the exam, [LAUGH]
>> [LAUGH]

164
00:09:40.630 --> 00:09:41.400
>> You need to know what

165
00:09:41.400 --> 00:09:42.709
you can do and where.

166
00:09:43.850 --> 00:09:46.560
So this lives within here, manage users.

167
00:09:46.560 --> 00:09:47.810
And we're just gonna keep going through,

168
00:09:47.810 --> 00:09:51.790
and we're just gonna note some
ones that we change often.

169
00:09:51.790 --> 00:09:54.500
So billing, business hours.

170
00:09:54.500 --> 00:09:57.550
And then some of these, you can see,
are checked by default.

171
00:09:57.550 --> 00:10:01.010
So you have view help link,
you can't make changes on that,

172
00:10:01.010 --> 00:10:05.540
but the Salesforce outbound messaging,
if that's something that you utilize,

173
00:10:05.540 --> 00:10:10.210
by default it's checked,
that they can for a standard user.

174
00:10:10.210 --> 00:10:15.060
So, just scrolling down to the bottom, you
also have just general user permission.

175
00:10:16.200 --> 00:10:19.020
So what do they have permission to do?

176
00:10:19.020 --> 00:10:23.300
Marketing users, if it was a profile for
a marketing user,

177
00:10:23.300 --> 00:10:25.600
they have the check boxes to manage leads.

178
00:10:25.600 --> 00:10:29.010
But we're in a standard user,
so we're not gonna see that.

179
00:10:29.010 --> 00:10:33.670
We'll go through, there's a few more
standard different profile types.

180
00:10:33.670 --> 00:10:38.590
Like marketing would have more
access to creating leads,

181
00:10:38.590 --> 00:10:41.630
whereas in sales user, you don't.

182
00:10:42.720 --> 00:10:45.370
Marketing user has
access to imports leads.

183
00:10:45.370 --> 00:10:48.360
So there's just a few more
options out the door.

184
00:10:48.360 --> 00:10:52.540
But, you can make it more
customized if you wanna open up

185
00:10:52.540 --> 00:10:54.690
that profile to have more access.

186
00:10:54.690 --> 00:10:58.012
So as I'm going through this,
you can see some of the options here.

187
00:10:58.012 --> 00:11:03.780
Reports is something that's requested
often, and then mass emails and edit task.

188
00:11:03.780 --> 00:11:09.030
But, another place to go to here for
is the standard object permissions.

189
00:11:09.030 --> 00:11:12.090
So this is the place
to go to to open up or

190
00:11:12.090 --> 00:11:15.770
restrict access to view the object itself.

191
00:11:15.770 --> 00:11:17.610
Maybe you created a custom object.

192
00:11:17.610 --> 00:11:21.870
This is where it would live, here,
and you can control who has accessed,

193
00:11:21.870 --> 00:11:24.700
based off the profile, to see it.

194
00:11:24.700 --> 00:11:26.290
So, it's not individual based.

195
00:11:26.290 --> 00:11:27.630
It's based off the profile.

196
00:11:28.820 --> 00:11:33.480
And you can change it, and you have the
option of it being read only, create only,

197
00:11:33.480 --> 00:11:36.000
read and edit, delete.

198
00:11:36.000 --> 00:11:39.970
And if it's view all or modify all,
you have those two other options here.

199
00:11:40.980 --> 00:11:43.890
Right now, for a standard user
you can see, and this is also

200
00:11:43.890 --> 00:11:48.100
a question that I have seen often, what
does a standard user have access to do?

201
00:11:48.100 --> 00:11:49.510
And it can be real specific.

202
00:11:49.510 --> 00:11:53.770
What does a standard user have
access to do for accounts?

203
00:11:53.770 --> 00:11:56.890
And so, it's really good
to spend some time on here.

204
00:11:56.890 --> 00:12:01.000
Maybe create some flash cards,
and know an account for

205
00:12:01.000 --> 00:12:04.270
a standard user can do read,
create, edit, delete.

206
00:12:05.430 --> 00:12:07.880
And some of these questions,
again, are multi-select.

207
00:12:07.880 --> 00:12:11.700
So if you do not select one,
the question is wrong.

208
00:12:11.700 --> 00:12:12.840
So it's marked wrong.

209
00:12:12.840 --> 00:12:17.250
So you may think you have a good
general or broad knowledge of security,

210
00:12:17.250 --> 00:12:20.740
but those questions can be real tricky and
real specific.

211
00:12:20.740 --> 00:12:24.330
And it gets this granular here,
as far as those questions go.

212
00:12:24.330 --> 00:12:30.350
So spend some time, go through into
each object as far as security goes.

213
00:12:30.350 --> 00:12:34.010
And know, more or less,
what standard users get for, I mean for

214
00:12:34.010 --> 00:12:35.720
standard profiles.

215
00:12:36.810 --> 00:12:40.560
So.
>> So you can clone the built-in profile.

216
00:12:40.560 --> 00:12:44.100
Can you also clone profiles
maybe that you have created?

217
00:12:44.100 --> 00:12:47.290
Yeah, definitely and so
you can have a whole list.

218
00:12:47.290 --> 00:12:51.260
So, this is just cloning from
existing standard profiles.

219
00:12:51.260 --> 00:12:53.509
So, we can just even
start at the real basics.

220
00:12:53.509 --> 00:12:56.220
I always use my quick
links to navigate back.

221
00:12:56.220 --> 00:12:59.175
And you can simply even
clone anything here.

222
00:12:59.175 --> 00:13:02.140
You'll have that clone
button on the homepage.

223
00:13:02.140 --> 00:13:04.450
And going back,
you have your list views here.

224
00:13:04.450 --> 00:13:07.030
But you can also select new profile.

225
00:13:07.030 --> 00:13:10.525
And it's asking you, I'm sorry,
did I click clone profile?

226
00:13:10.525 --> 00:13:11.210
[LAUGH]
>> [LAUGH]

227
00:13:11.210 --> 00:13:13.040
>> New profile up here.

228
00:13:13.040 --> 00:13:16.110
And it looks like it's asking to clone.

229
00:13:16.110 --> 00:13:17.100
But we don't wanna clone.

230
00:13:17.100 --> 00:13:18.920
We want to start new.

231
00:13:18.920 --> 00:13:22.830
So you do have to select
>> Kind of a starting point?

232
00:13:22.830 --> 00:13:24.320
>> Yeah, starting point here.

233
00:13:24.320 --> 00:13:27.490
So, same steps, and it's gonna take
you to the next part right there.

234
00:13:27.490 --> 00:13:28.910
So-
>> Seems like that clone option will be

235
00:13:28.910 --> 00:13:32.780
really handy, because the profiles can
be so granular with the permissions.

236
00:13:32.780 --> 00:13:36.410
And if you've got another group of
people that needs very similar access,

237
00:13:36.410 --> 00:13:38.590
slight differences,
I don't have to start from scratch.

238
00:13:38.590 --> 00:13:41.630
I can clone my existing profile,
tweak it a little bit, rename it,

239
00:13:41.630 --> 00:13:42.510
and we're good to go.

240
00:13:42.510 --> 00:13:43.340
>> Right, right.

241
00:13:43.340 --> 00:13:44.980
And so some of these,
as you were saying here,

242
00:13:44.980 --> 00:13:48.380
some of these profiles, going through
some of the most common ones,

243
00:13:48.380 --> 00:13:51.240
we talked about standard user, and
we talked about the System admin.

244
00:13:51.240 --> 00:13:53.460
We talked a little bit about
the marketing user, but

245
00:13:53.460 --> 00:13:55.980
some other ones would be the read only's.

246
00:13:55.980 --> 00:14:01.204
So maybe you have a group of users that
need to just be able to see the data and

247
00:14:01.204 --> 00:14:02.870
not make changes.

248
00:14:02.870 --> 00:14:04.200
So you have the read only.

249
00:14:04.200 --> 00:14:07.340
We'd only assign them
the read only profile here.

250
00:14:07.340 --> 00:14:08.850
And you can see that.

251
00:14:10.090 --> 00:14:12.660
And to do that,
you would go into the user itself.

252
00:14:13.840 --> 00:14:17.290
If you went into the profile,
too, you saw view all users.

253
00:14:17.290 --> 00:14:20.230
You can see the group of
users that are assigned it.

254
00:14:20.230 --> 00:14:24.380
But usually, I'm going on a per
user basis, and I'm looking at,

255
00:14:24.380 --> 00:14:28.540
say chatter expert was a person,
and I can see to my right.

256
00:14:28.540 --> 00:14:33.230
Okay, he has this type of profile, but
he really should have this profile.

257
00:14:33.230 --> 00:14:36.800
Maybe there is a promotion, and
now he has more access, and

258
00:14:36.800 --> 00:14:39.350
maybe someone was granted
a promotion to be a system admin.

259
00:14:39.350 --> 00:14:42.340
You go into the user profile itself.

260
00:14:42.340 --> 00:14:47.250
And you, if this was changing from
a chatter free to a Salesforce license,

261
00:14:47.250 --> 00:14:48.950
the only way to do that,

262
00:14:48.950 --> 00:14:52.910
your profiles are only given based
off of the license that you have.

263
00:14:52.910 --> 00:14:55.850
So I can't change them to
a standard user at this point.

264
00:14:55.850 --> 00:14:58.260
I would have to change his
license to a Salesforce license.

265
00:14:59.520 --> 00:15:02.760
And then I can select from my
list of licenses available.

266
00:15:02.760 --> 00:15:04.740
So we have read only.

267
00:15:04.740 --> 00:15:10.910
So now, I want this chatter expert to
be read-only on my Salesforce records.

268
00:15:10.910 --> 00:15:15.470
Or his privileges, more privileges, and
now I bumped him up to a system admin.

269
00:15:15.470 --> 00:15:18.570
We needed to hire another one and
we have a second system admin.

270
00:15:18.570 --> 00:15:19.820
You just make those changes here.

271
00:15:19.820 --> 00:15:24.590
And all the changes within that
profile are now, once you hit save,

272
00:15:24.590 --> 00:15:28.955
are now given to this user,
to anyone assigned this profile.

273
00:15:31.663 --> 00:15:35.688
As I go into the profiles,
back again, you can see,

274
00:15:35.688 --> 00:15:38.720
let's go back into our standard user.

275
00:15:41.039 --> 00:15:46.070
Or let's go into, yes,
don't think I saved the other one.

276
00:15:46.070 --> 00:15:49.440
So we're gonna go back into the standard
user, and just show you further down.

277
00:15:49.440 --> 00:15:50.933
So we went through the tab settings.

278
00:15:50.933 --> 00:15:56.433
We went through the objects and
another point to this where a lot of

279
00:15:56.433 --> 00:16:01.936
changes are record-type settings and
field-level security.

280
00:16:01.936 --> 00:16:05.758
So, you can also make changes here as
to what record types that you made.

281
00:16:05.758 --> 00:16:11.160
So Most common scenario maybe have
a B2B side and then a B2C side.

282
00:16:12.288 --> 00:16:15.290
And as you're creating an account or
leads,

283
00:16:15.290 --> 00:16:17.825
you have two different record types.

284
00:16:17.825 --> 00:16:21.510
You can have the record type for
your accounts business to business and

285
00:16:21.510 --> 00:16:24.935
then you can have a record type for
your B2C side of customers.

286
00:16:24.935 --> 00:16:29.535
Maybe we have different sales reps only
responsible for those territories,

287
00:16:29.535 --> 00:16:33.925
so when you create those
different record types,

288
00:16:33.925 --> 00:16:36.670
this is just high level view
of record types in Salesforce.

289
00:16:37.745 --> 00:16:40.325
You can only see certain page layouts,

290
00:16:40.325 --> 00:16:44.520
certain fields that are applicable
to he record type you're in.

291
00:16:44.520 --> 00:16:49.416
So at this point, if I have a sales user,
maybe they don't need to see a sales

292
00:16:49.416 --> 00:16:53.720
B2Bs or maybe they don't need to see B2C
record types, or even see the option.

293
00:16:53.720 --> 00:16:57.880
So at this point, this is where you
restrict access to the record type

294
00:16:58.890 --> 00:17:02.490
itself which then within
it holds the page layout.

295
00:17:02.490 --> 00:17:05.420
So that's for that section here.

296
00:17:05.420 --> 00:17:08.990
And as we went through all the admin
permissions that they can do.

297
00:17:08.990 --> 00:17:13.310
And then a general user permissions
that we went kinda through.

298
00:17:13.310 --> 00:17:19.970
And now you go through at the bottom and
you have the options for session settings.

299
00:17:19.970 --> 00:17:23.470
So for these group of users,
should they time out after 15,

300
00:17:23.470 --> 00:17:27.000
32 hours [LAUGH] of inactivity,
you can make the changes there.

301
00:17:27.000 --> 00:17:32.120
And then password policies,
how much do you wanna time to change or

302
00:17:32.120 --> 00:17:33.960
renew their password.

303
00:17:33.960 --> 00:17:37.590
Password length, you have some options
there, this is all based off the profile.

304
00:17:37.590 --> 00:17:40.850
So, that can change for
different types of users.

305
00:17:40.850 --> 00:17:44.250
If you want more, control over that.

306
00:17:44.250 --> 00:17:47.970
And then, in the profile itself
is where you can see the changes

307
00:17:47.970 --> 00:17:49.900
to the log in hours.

308
00:17:49.900 --> 00:17:54.560
So you can have your options to
change from only be able to access or

309
00:17:54.560 --> 00:17:57.770
be logged in from eight to five,
Monday through Friday.

310
00:17:57.770 --> 00:18:02.640
If they're trying to log in on a Saturday,
they don't

311
00:18:02.640 --> 00:18:08.068
have access again in this cloud based, so
they could access from their computer.

312
00:18:08.068 --> 00:18:12.770
If you wanna even restrict that and have
them only able to access their computers

313
00:18:12.770 --> 00:18:18.890
from the company itself, then you can
log in for a group of users by profile.

314
00:18:18.890 --> 00:18:23.990
Here in this section where you log
those IP ranges at the profile level.

315
00:18:23.990 --> 00:18:28.970
And then a lot of options as far
as what apex classes can they see,

316
00:18:28.970 --> 00:18:31.030
what Visualforce pages can they see.

317
00:18:31.030 --> 00:18:35.025
Maybe there were some custom
development that you did,

318
00:18:35.025 --> 00:18:37.915
I'm the only one viewable to a profile.

319
00:18:37.915 --> 00:18:42.022
This is where you kind of change
those permissions and access there.

320
00:18:44.123 --> 00:18:51.086
So that gives you a good idea as far
as what you can do with the profiles,

321
00:18:51.086 --> 00:18:56.294
what changes you can make as
far as what a user can do.

322
00:18:56.294 --> 00:19:02.420
Now to open up access,
I suggested keep it at a bare minimum.

323
00:19:02.420 --> 00:19:06.920
Okay, what do I do if I need
to give one user permission or

324
00:19:06.920 --> 00:19:09.880
give someone a permission set.

325
00:19:09.880 --> 00:19:15.056
So you wanna go over here to manage
users and give them a permission set.

326
00:19:15.056 --> 00:19:21.756
So maybe my example, someone fell into
a profile where they were only able to,

327
00:19:21.756 --> 00:19:27.750
let say they can't setup reports, so they
were part of a standard profile and report

328
00:19:27.750 --> 00:19:32.220
management was not up of the wall to
that group of users within that profile.

329
00:19:32.220 --> 00:19:36.500
But maybe there's one person who sits in
there that I want them to have permission,

330
00:19:36.500 --> 00:19:40.790
so you create these permission sets and
we have one living here,

331
00:19:40.790 --> 00:19:46.730
there aren't any by default it create us
one previously called permission sets.

332
00:19:46.730 --> 00:19:50.400
I will make more descriptive but
you'll also have a description too.

333
00:19:50.400 --> 00:19:53.140
Because you can have a long
list of permission sets.

334
00:19:53.140 --> 00:19:57.770
And of course since Salesforce,
any object page has a list view here.

335
00:19:57.770 --> 00:20:00.350
You're kinda sorting
through some of these.

336
00:20:00.350 --> 00:20:04.940
And in this permission set right here, it
will give you that list and it will show

337
00:20:04.940 --> 00:20:09.100
you the list of options that you can
make at the profile level that we saw.

338
00:20:09.100 --> 00:20:10.900
So all those options and

339
00:20:10.900 --> 00:20:16.850
fields that we saw to make at an
administrative level you can assign here.

340
00:20:16.850 --> 00:20:19.790
So I would select who do
I wanna assign it to?

341
00:20:19.790 --> 00:20:21.080
What user?

342
00:20:21.080 --> 00:20:25.620
Was the permission and
I can select and search off that list.

343
00:20:25.620 --> 00:20:28.070
And in this one right here,
I just wanna give

344
00:20:28.070 --> 00:20:32.010
someone permission to create report
folders or just create reports.

345
00:20:32.010 --> 00:20:33.880
There's a lot of options there.

346
00:20:33.880 --> 00:20:37.770
It's gonna ask for
the license first, and then name it,

347
00:20:37.770 --> 00:20:41.640
and make those changes and
assign the profile here.

348
00:20:41.640 --> 00:20:43.490
So if you wanna manage assignments,

349
00:20:45.420 --> 00:20:49.270
it's gonna take you to adding
the assignment, itself.

350
00:20:49.270 --> 00:20:52.050
So right now we're still living within
that one, who are we gonna assign it to,

351
00:20:52.050 --> 00:20:53.400
at this point?

352
00:20:53.400 --> 00:20:57.500
And then me, I'm a system admin so
I may not need it but

353
00:20:57.500 --> 00:21:02.840
I can assign it to our example of a
chatter expert, and assign this one here.

354
00:21:02.840 --> 00:21:06.130
So If there is an error,
which is a great way to troubleshoot.

355
00:21:06.130 --> 00:21:07.300
You'll see why.

356
00:21:07.300 --> 00:21:11.400
So this one is example cuz we can't
assign it to a chatter expert.

357
00:21:11.400 --> 00:21:14.370
Chatter expert is not
a Salesforce license.

358
00:21:14.370 --> 00:21:17.740
So they have to have
the right license to do so.

359
00:21:17.740 --> 00:21:21.900
And most of the time it's
gonna be a Salesforce license.

360
00:21:21.900 --> 00:21:26.540
And then, they'll have access to be
assigned any type of permission set.

361
00:21:26.540 --> 00:21:29.680
So this is happening cuz
we're in a development org.

362
00:21:29.680 --> 00:21:32.030
But as long as they
have the right license,

363
00:21:32.030 --> 00:21:34.402
you can assign them
the right permission set.

364
00:21:34.402 --> 00:21:36.389
>> Fantastic,

365
00:21:36.389 --> 00:21:40.900
are we limited to one permission set or
can we start combining those?

366
00:21:40.900 --> 00:21:42.360
>> Yeah, that's a great question.

367
00:21:42.360 --> 00:21:45.810
So you can have as many permission sets.

368
00:21:45.810 --> 00:21:49.171
I can grant you as many
permission sets as I need.

369
00:21:49.171 --> 00:21:50.419
>> Very nice.
>> Yep.

370
00:21:50.419 --> 00:21:51.170
>> All right.

371
00:21:51.170 --> 00:21:54.405
Well, Felicia again another great
look there at controlling access.

372
00:21:54.405 --> 00:21:57.385
Security access,
obviously a very important part

373
00:21:57.385 --> 00:22:02.665
in our administration of our org within
Salesforce, as well as for the exam.

374
00:22:02.665 --> 00:22:04.215
Make sure you take Felicia's advice there.

375
00:22:04.215 --> 00:22:07.877
Study up on those, lot of permissions
involved with those profiles right?

376
00:22:07.877 --> 00:22:09.827
Take a look at that standard user profile.

377
00:22:09.827 --> 00:22:12.557
Get familiar with what level of access

378
00:22:12.557 --> 00:22:15.877
you're gonna be giving somebody when
you assign that profile to them.

379
00:22:15.877 --> 00:22:16.977
So we thank you for that Felicia,

380
00:22:16.977 --> 00:22:19.277
we hope everybody out there
enjoyed watching this one.

381
00:22:19.277 --> 00:22:22.257
Signing off for ITProTV,
I've been your host Mike Rodrick.

382
00:22:22.257 --> 00:22:23.147
>> I'm Felicia Duarte.

383
00:22:23.147 --> 00:22:25.442
>> And we'll see you next time.

384
00:22:25.442 --> 00:22:31.618
[MUSIC]

385
00:22:31.618 --> 00:22:33.430
>> Thank you for watching ITProTV.

episodes.description: In this episode, Felicia and Mike demonstrate using profiles in Salesforce to control access. They look at the built-in profiles as well as ways to clone and modify profiles.
episodes.title: Lead Management
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.008 --> 00:00:02.589
Welcome to ITPro.TV,
I'm your host Don Pezet.

2
00:00:02.589 --> 00:00:06.271
[CROSSTALK]

3
00:00:06.271 --> 00:00:08.271
[MUSIC]

4
00:00:08.271 --> 00:00:12.200
>> You're watching ITPro.TV.

5
00:00:12.200 --> 00:00:15.942
>> Hello, welcome to another
exciting episode here at ITPro.TV.

6
00:00:15.942 --> 00:00:17.099
I'm your host Mike Rodrick.

7
00:00:17.099 --> 00:00:20.422
And today, we are doing our
Salesforce Certified Administrator.

8
00:00:20.422 --> 00:00:24.760
And in this episode we're gonna be
focusing in on lead management.

9
00:00:24.760 --> 00:00:28.148
And here to lend her expertise in
the area is Ms. Felicia Duarte.

10
00:00:28.148 --> 00:00:29.338
Welcome back, Felicia.

11
00:00:29.338 --> 00:00:30.032
>> Great, thanks.

12
00:00:30.032 --> 00:00:31.106
Hello, everyone.

13
00:00:31.106 --> 00:00:35.830
So in this topic, this episode,
I'm gonna cover lead management.

14
00:00:35.830 --> 00:00:39.240
This is covered in the exam,
they're gonna ask you questions.

15
00:00:39.240 --> 00:00:43.830
Expect to see questions on lead
assignment rules, lead queues,

16
00:00:43.830 --> 00:00:49.260
converting leads, basic functionality of
a lead, what the fields within the leads.

17
00:00:49.260 --> 00:00:53.654
So I'll start there and I'll start very
high level as far as the lead homepage,

18
00:00:53.654 --> 00:00:55.696
some of the fields within the leads.

19
00:00:55.696 --> 00:01:00.256
And we'll work our way all the way down
to web to leads and creating web to lead.

20
00:01:00.256 --> 00:01:05.789
So let's navigate over here from our home
screen over unto the lead object itself.

21
00:01:07.160 --> 00:01:13.420
Now there are some common misconceptions
within Salesforce as what is a lead?

22
00:01:13.420 --> 00:01:16.030
So within the org it can be tricky,

23
00:01:16.030 --> 00:01:19.800
it can be confusing as far
as what's considered a lead.

24
00:01:19.800 --> 00:01:22.850
A lead with Salesforce is
an unqualified prospect.

25

episodes.description: In this episode, Felicia and Mike look at working with accounts and contacts in Salesforce. They go over the standard fields as well as custom fields. They also look at one-to-many and master-detail relationships.
episodes.title: Accounts and Contacts
