that work within the business.

338
00:20:54.562 --> 00:20:57.909
So this will show,
let's see account manager.

339
00:20:57.909 --> 00:21:01.238
Now I'm gonna check to
see if I can do myself.

340
00:21:01.238 --> 00:21:06.470
I want read/write access to
any accounts opportunities or

341
00:21:06.470 --> 00:21:11.360
cases related to this account that we're
in, right now for Cloud Creations South.

342
00:21:11.360 --> 00:21:12.480
My role in this is I'm an account manager.

343
00:21:12.480 --> 00:21:15.960
And I can add more if I need to add more.

344
00:21:17.050 --> 00:21:21.270
And, so, as we scroll to the bottom,
we can see and have different team members

345
00:21:21.270 --> 00:21:27.230
and see everyone's access and
role within this account.

346
00:21:29.250 --> 00:21:33.040
>> All right, Felicia, again a great look
there at how we can deal with accounts and

347
00:21:33.040 --> 00:21:37.300
contacts within Salesforce working with
the different properties available.

348
00:21:37.300 --> 00:21:41.175
And how we can start using account teams
to make sharing of that information

349
00:21:41.175 --> 00:21:43.260
amongst our team members
a little bit easier.

350
00:21:43.260 --> 00:21:45.050
So we thank you for that Felicia.

351
00:21:45.050 --> 00:21:47.210
I hope everybody out there
enjoyed watching this one.

352
00:21:47.210 --> 00:21:50.280
Signing off for ITProTV,
I've been your host Mike Rodrick.

353
00:21:50.280 --> 00:21:51.100
>> I'm Felicia Duarte.

354
00:21:51.100 --> 00:21:51.666
>> And we'll see you next time.

355
00:21:51.666 --> 00:21:59.555
[MUSIC]

356
00:21:59.555 --> 00:22:01.495
>> Thank you for watching ITProTV.

episodes.description: In this episode, Felicia and Mike take a look at creating opportunities in Salesforce. They go over both the required and optional fields available when creating an opportunity.
episodes.title: Opportunities
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.003 --> 00:00:05.830
Welcome to ITPro.TV,
I'm your host Don Pezet [CROSSTALK]

2
00:00:05.830 --> 00:00:08.298
[MUSIC]

3
00:00:08.298 --> 00:00:12.304
>> You're watching ITPro.TV.

4
00:00:12.304 --> 00:00:15.701
>> Hello welcome to another
exciting episode here at ITPro.TV.

5
00:00:15.701 --> 00:00:17.222
I'm your host Mike Rodrick and

6
00:00:17.222 --> 00:00:20.820
today we're doing our Salesforce
certified administrator.

7
00:00:20.820 --> 00:00:23.984
In this episode we're gonna continue
taking a look at standard objects

8
00:00:23.984 --> 00:00:24.941
within Salesforce.

9
00:00:24.941 --> 00:00:27.360
We're gonna be taking
a look at opportunities.

10
00:00:27.360 --> 00:00:30.860
What they are, how we can work with them,
what we can do with them.

11
00:00:30.860 --> 00:00:34.900
And here to help us explain all
of that is Ms. Felicia Duarte.

12
00:00:34.900 --> 00:00:35.770
Hello, Felicia.

13
00:00:35.770 --> 00:00:37.220
>> Hello, thanks for having me.

14
00:00:37.220 --> 00:00:40.247
So, in this episode today,
I'm going to cover opportunities.

15
00:00:40.247 --> 00:00:45.130
Opportunities still holds weight within
the sales cloud questions on the exam.

16
00:00:45.130 --> 00:00:48.820
So this goes in relation to the accountant
contacts that we just went over in

17
00:00:48.820 --> 00:00:50.040
the last episode.

18
00:00:50.040 --> 00:00:53.960
But opportunities as a whole has its
own sort of weight in questions that

19
00:00:53.960 --> 00:00:56.470
are most common that you'll
see that I'll go over today.

20
00:00:56.470 --> 00:01:00.400
So I'm gonna start with
the opportunity definition.

21
00:01:00.400 --> 00:01:03.660
What is considered
an opportunity in Salesforce?

22
00:01:03.660 --> 00:01:08.100
This can be seen or
used or renamed to deals.

23
00:01:08.100 --> 00:01:12.490
So what is the potential amount that
you see an opportunity that someone has

24
00:01:12.490 --> 00:01:13.960
to do business with you.

25
00:01:13.960 --> 00:01:21.280
And we'll kind of start there and navigate
into Salesforce on the homepage tab here.

26
00:01:21.280 --> 00:01:24.430
So this contains the info of
every deal that you're tracking.

27
00:01:25.990 --> 00:01:28.610
Right here at the homepage,
I'm just going to start first and

28
00:01:28.610 --> 00:01:31.860
dive right into an existing
opportunity record.

29
00:01:31.860 --> 00:01:34.320
Let's go into American Banking Corp.

30
00:01:34.320 --> 00:01:37.000
Now, you'll see here already

31
00:01:37.000 --> 00:01:40.280
an existing opportunity is
gonna be related to an account.

32
00:01:40.280 --> 00:01:44.630
So I'm gonna scroll to the Detail
page of my Opportunity and

33
00:01:44.630 --> 00:01:47.120
I can see this is related to this account.

34
00:01:47.120 --> 00:01:52.400
Now, in Opportunity you can have multiple
opportunities for any given account.

35
00:01:52.400 --> 00:01:55.920
Your stage will show,
where is this Opportunity?

36
00:01:55.920 --> 00:01:57.870
Living within my sales pipeline.

37
00:01:57.870 --> 00:02:00.910
In this example this stage
is still prospecting.

38
00:02:00.910 --> 00:02:04.282
Salesforce out of the box
gives you a list of stages,

39
00:02:04.282 --> 00:02:09.127
but they can always be personalized and
customized to your sales process.

40
00:02:09.127 --> 00:02:13.747
What does your pipeline look like, at what
point do you wanna be able to tell how

41
00:02:13.747 --> 00:02:16.897
long they've been sitting
within each sales stage?

42
00:02:16.897 --> 00:02:20.240
Right now,
if I double click into my stage.

43
00:02:22.910 --> 00:02:24.527
I can see my stage and probability.

44
00:02:24.527 --> 00:02:27.640
You see the red required
field highlighted here.

45
00:02:27.640 --> 00:02:31.031
So you know that this is
a required field in order to save

46
00:02:31.031 --> 00:02:33.553
any opportunity record in sales force.

47
00:02:33.553 --> 00:02:37.840
Now, I will say with these values
here that Salesforce gives you.

48
00:02:37.840 --> 00:02:43.330
They give you prospect, qualification,
analysis, the proposal.

49
00:02:43.330 --> 00:02:45.738
Some options that are usually used.

50
00:02:45.738 --> 00:02:48.500
But then we also have closed one and
closed last.

51
00:02:48.500 --> 00:02:52.020
You can see it right here by
leave it sitting in prospecting.

52
00:02:52.020 --> 00:02:55.820
You have the probability and so the
probability in Salesforce is gonna show

53
00:02:55.820 --> 00:03:00.540
your potential at closing
this opportunity to sale.

54
00:03:00.540 --> 00:03:04.860
If I move it closer to closed one,
its gonna be a 100%,

55
00:03:04.860 --> 00:03:06.900
I won the sale, I won the deal.

56
00:03:06.900 --> 00:03:09.651
Close loss of course,
it's gonna move over to zero.

57
00:03:09.651 --> 00:03:14.858
And you have control into what
percentages are tied to each stage.

58
00:03:14.858 --> 00:03:19.670
So as you go in and make changes
to those values for this field.

59
00:03:19.670 --> 00:03:24.288
You also have the option to
selecting the probability of it.

60
00:03:24.288 --> 00:03:26.680
So, needs analysis and move to 20.

61
00:03:26.680 --> 00:03:31.876
And you can kind of catch how this is
working down the line in the stage fields.

62
00:03:31.876 --> 00:03:36.293
>> So you're saying that is customizable
I could change that that analysis stage.

63
00:03:36.293 --> 00:03:38.930
It might be 60% in my book and not 70%.

64
00:03:38.930 --> 00:03:39.521
>> Exactly.

65
00:03:39.521 --> 00:03:40.196
Right.

66
00:03:40.196 --> 00:03:40.748
>> Very cool.

67
00:03:40.748 --> 00:03:41.491
>> I'll show you here.

68
00:03:41.491 --> 00:03:42.355
Go to view fields.

69
00:03:42.355 --> 00:03:44.910
So you know where and
how to make those changes.

70
00:03:44.910 --> 00:03:48.310
So every stage has to have
that probability tied to it.

71
00:03:48.310 --> 00:03:51.740
So that's why you'll see both of
those fields as required fields.

72
00:03:51.740 --> 00:03:53.498
So if I dive into stage here.

73
00:03:55.461 --> 00:03:59.040
You can see your options for
field dependencies, validation rules.

74
00:03:59.040 --> 00:04:00.600
But these are my options.

75
00:04:00.600 --> 00:04:01.804
Let's say, hey,

76
00:04:01.804 --> 00:04:06.412
I really don't value the proposition
first in my type of organization.

77
00:04:06.412 --> 00:04:09.100
So I'm gonna deactivate this.

78
00:04:10.590 --> 00:04:12.110
Maybe in the future, I might use it.

79
00:04:12.110 --> 00:04:18.196
But right now, I'm just going to
deactivate it instead of deleting it so.

80
00:04:18.196 --> 00:04:18.770
You sure?

81
00:04:20.750 --> 00:04:23.960
And while it's loading right here
you can also see the options to

82
00:04:23.960 --> 00:04:26.280
same place to reorder, replace.

83
00:04:26.280 --> 00:04:30.060
There's printable views so as I'm
working sometimes I find this helpful.

84
00:04:31.510 --> 00:04:33.570
So this looks like it's
tied to the record I'm,

85
00:04:33.570 --> 00:04:35.440
to one of the existing
records that I'm in.

86
00:04:35.440 --> 00:04:37.530
So this is a good way to kind of show you.

87
00:04:37.530 --> 00:04:39.500
If it's tied to something or

88
00:04:39.500 --> 00:04:43.440
being modified by another user you
can't deactivate it right now.

89
00:04:43.440 --> 00:04:44.407
So go and make those changes.

90
00:04:44.407 --> 00:04:46.167
So I'm going to take a step back and

91
00:04:46.167 --> 00:04:49.404
continue what I was going to show
you which is a printable view.

92
00:04:49.404 --> 00:04:55.300
So this is often helpful if I'm moving
orgs from one place to another.

93
00:04:55.300 --> 00:05:00.151
Or if I'm looking to kind of collect
all of these fields and transfer them.

94
00:05:00.151 --> 00:05:02.726
I can simply highlight
it this way when it's,

95
00:05:02.726 --> 00:05:05.443
in this place it's just
a little harder to do so.

96
00:05:05.443 --> 00:05:09.821
So that's my little tip there but
let's go ahead and

97
00:05:09.821 --> 00:05:14.895
check to change over the name of,
let's just edit this one,

98
00:05:14.895 --> 00:05:18.030
closed one, to kind of show you.

99
00:05:18.030 --> 00:05:22.440
So this will show you as you're changing
the pick list fields, the type that it is,

100
00:05:22.440 --> 00:05:26.538
so the different types you have is a sale
open, is a closed one or closed lost.

101
00:05:26.538 --> 00:05:30.126
So maybe you have a different
naming convention for closed one or

102
00:05:30.126 --> 00:05:33.720
maybe it's committed and
that's your version of a closed one.

103
00:05:33.720 --> 00:05:39.280
So you can create a new stage and
name it as a type being as a one sale.

104
00:05:39.280 --> 00:05:43.820
This way for your forecasting it
doesn't fall into the wrong bucket.

105
00:05:43.820 --> 00:05:46.385
And then still have it named committed,
being the example.

106
00:05:46.385 --> 00:05:50.230
And then the probability for
closed one would be 100 but

107
00:05:50.230 --> 00:05:54.965
you can see here, I can name it 99
if I want, or you have that option.

108
00:05:54.965 --> 00:05:58.715
But that's tied to every
single stage value.

109
00:05:58.715 --> 00:06:03.211
And in forecast categories, you're
opportunities tie closely to forecasting.

110
00:06:03.211 --> 00:06:08.405
So this would be marked as closed,
because you no longer need to forecast it.

111
00:06:08.405 --> 00:06:13.914
But some of your other options could be
admitted, pipeline, best case, and commit.

112
00:06:13.914 --> 00:06:17.230
So, I'm gonna go back.

113
00:06:17.230 --> 00:06:22.024
We do wanna keep, most organizations do
keep closed won and closed lost, but some

114
00:06:22.024 --> 00:06:27.035
of these other ones, I'll usually change,
and you can see some of the details here.

115
00:06:27.035 --> 00:06:30.470
But let's navigate back
into our opportunities.

116
00:06:30.470 --> 00:06:32.560
And let's go into the most recent record.

117
00:06:35.600 --> 00:06:39.190
And as a hit edit,
you will see the required feild.

118
00:06:39.190 --> 00:06:42.100
So you always have to
have an Opportunity Name.

119
00:06:42.100 --> 00:06:46.611
Now, best practice is usually if
you're selling a service or a product,

120
00:06:46.611 --> 00:06:49.242
it can usually be that service or product.

121
00:06:49.242 --> 00:06:53.072
So Salesforce right here,
I think, for this Opportunity and

122
00:06:53.072 --> 00:06:55.300
we may not have products tied to it.

123
00:06:55.300 --> 00:06:59.651
Financial service companies, so
maybe there, in that industry,

124
00:06:59.651 --> 00:07:03.483
their opportunities can be
the on boarding of a new client.

125
00:07:03.483 --> 00:07:07.960
So, maybe they name it the accounts name,
or the client's name, or the type of deal.

126
00:07:07.960 --> 00:07:10.016
I would say be as descriptive as you can,
or

127
00:07:10.016 --> 00:07:12.610
have your users be as
descriptive as you can.

128
00:07:12.610 --> 00:07:17.150
So this way if you have an account
with multiple opportunities.

129
00:07:17.150 --> 00:07:19.902
You are able to distinguish
from each other.

130
00:07:19.902 --> 00:07:23.310
You always have to have a close date.

131
00:07:23.310 --> 00:07:29.790
So again all these are important for when
you're importing data and historical data.

132
00:07:29.790 --> 00:07:32.131
If they don't align or don't match up.

133
00:07:32.131 --> 00:07:33.270
You have to map it somewhere.

134
00:07:33.270 --> 00:07:36.295
You have to map something to it.

135
00:07:36.295 --> 00:07:37.320
So close date.

136
00:07:37.320 --> 00:07:38.483
When do you expect to close the deal?

137
00:07:38.483 --> 00:07:41.921
If it's a historical data,
if it's a closed one sale and

138
00:07:41.921 --> 00:07:45.590
you're looking to push it in,
use that as your closed date.

139
00:07:45.590 --> 00:07:48.640
But nothing happens if you
go past the closed date.

140
00:07:48.640 --> 00:07:50.036
You can always change the closed date.

141
00:07:50.036 --> 00:07:54.474
This is just kind of your best guess
at when you expect to close the deal.

142
00:07:54.474 --> 00:07:58.497
So this one,
we expect it to close in March of 31st.

143
00:07:58.497 --> 00:08:02.032
This is the calendar,
which you can select.

144
00:08:02.032 --> 00:08:05.583
If I wanna change it to today's date,
I can select this here.

145
00:08:05.583 --> 00:08:09.630
But you can see, it's pretty easy to
change it and make changes to here.

146
00:08:09.630 --> 00:08:12.240
Maybe I'm no longer in
the prospecting stage, and

147
00:08:12.240 --> 00:08:15.960
we're closer to this deal, and
I am in proposal price quote.

148
00:08:15.960 --> 00:08:19.376
You can see the probability
automatically ties and changes for you.

149
00:08:19.376 --> 00:08:21.051
But you can't leave that blank.

150
00:08:21.051 --> 00:08:26.348
And maybe I had more information related.

151
00:08:26.348 --> 00:08:29.828
If it was generators, or
basic information you can relate,

152
00:08:29.828 --> 00:08:34.139
you can enter that information here,
create custom fields to collect it.

153
00:08:34.139 --> 00:08:39.941
But for more retail-related industries or
for those companies that have services.

154
00:08:39.941 --> 00:08:44.853
You're gonna want to list those as
products and I'll show in another episode

155
00:08:44.853 --> 00:08:48.570
the relationships between products and
opportunities.

156
00:08:48.570 --> 00:08:52.760
But right now we're just strictly talking
what information is gonna be important to

157
00:08:52.760 --> 00:08:55.060
hold at the opportunity level.

158
00:08:55.060 --> 00:08:59.930
A question again I've seen on the test,
what are the required fields?

159
00:08:59.930 --> 00:09:04.110
Close date, stage, the opportunity name.

160
00:09:04.110 --> 00:09:09.130
So we're gonna hit
Save To show the changes.

161
00:09:09.130 --> 00:09:10.630
Now best practice,

162
00:09:10.630 --> 00:09:15.140
is I like to go, if I'm creating a new
opportunity, there are two ways to do it.

163
00:09:15.140 --> 00:09:19.336
So I can go to the Quick Create
that we see in the far left, or

164
00:09:19.336 --> 00:09:23.379
I can just go into the opportunity
record and click New.

165
00:09:23.379 --> 00:09:25.961
You want to avoid as
many clicks as you can.

166
00:09:25.961 --> 00:09:27.401
>> [LAUGH]
>> [LAUGH] So again,

167
00:09:27.401 --> 00:09:30.494
navigate to the account first,
if the account exists.

168
00:09:30.494 --> 00:09:34.883
Because if you're doing it backwards, and
you're trying to enter an opportunity

169
00:09:34.883 --> 00:09:37.843
where the account doesn't exist,
or maybe it exists.

170
00:09:37.843 --> 00:09:41.406
You're just having to double click or
enter more places, and

171
00:09:41.406 --> 00:09:43.539
it's not adoptable to other users.

172
00:09:43.539 --> 00:09:49.598
So, if I wanted to create an account,
I can select this lookup.

173
00:09:49.598 --> 00:09:53.438
And if you have this feature enabled,
which, by default it is.

174
00:09:53.438 --> 00:09:56.664
Maybe the account doesn't exist and
I looked in my lookup field and

175
00:09:56.664 --> 00:09:57.651
it can't find one.

176
00:09:57.651 --> 00:10:01.161
You can also, and
it's often missed, select New.

177
00:10:01.161 --> 00:10:05.763
And this is kinda of your quick create as
you're creating the opportunity to also

178
00:10:05.763 --> 00:10:06.921
create an account.

179
00:10:09.577 --> 00:10:11.832
>> Very nice.
I mean that saves me from having to go,

180
00:10:11.832 --> 00:10:12.958
it doesn't exist yet.

181
00:10:12.958 --> 00:10:15.216
>> [LAUGH]
>> Now I gotta go all the way back out,

182
00:10:15.216 --> 00:10:16.265
create the account.

183
00:10:16.265 --> 00:10:18.793
And then do it all over again,
that's really nice.

184
00:10:18.793 --> 00:10:19.866
>> Yeah, yeah, and so

185
00:10:19.866 --> 00:10:23.810
let me go over into some other cool
features that Opportunities have.

186
00:10:23.810 --> 00:10:24.880
So Opportunity,

187
00:10:24.880 --> 00:10:30.300
it's gonna hold the details of
what you wanna capture in a deal.

188
00:10:30.300 --> 00:10:31.500
Did you send out samples?

189
00:10:31.500 --> 00:10:33.010
How many samples did you send?

190
00:10:33.010 --> 00:10:34.770
What was their feedback?

191
00:10:34.770 --> 00:10:37.050
Have you sent out a quote?

192
00:10:37.050 --> 00:10:41.720
So those are just most of
the custom fields that we set up.

193
00:10:41.720 --> 00:10:44.360
But from a system admin standpoint,

194
00:10:44.360 --> 00:10:49.840
maybe you're requested to keep track of
some of the partners related to this deal.

195
00:10:49.840 --> 00:10:53.420
Or maybe you even wanna keep
track of some of the competitors.

196
00:10:53.420 --> 00:10:56.340
Salesforce, if I were to select New and

197
00:10:56.340 --> 00:11:00.940
you wanna make changes here, you're
looking right here to a list of accounts.

198
00:11:00.940 --> 00:11:03.160
So, again, they would have to exist first.

199
00:11:03.160 --> 00:11:06.557
If they don't then you're just
entering it here with the New button.

200
00:11:06.557 --> 00:11:11.310
But if you want to collect a list of all
the partners associated to a specific

201
00:11:11.310 --> 00:11:12.295
opportunity.

202
00:11:12.295 --> 00:11:18.333
You want to drag that list onto
the Opportunity object and define a role.

203
00:11:18.333 --> 00:11:23.256
This is sometimes often missed by other
system admins as to where the changes can

204
00:11:23.256 --> 00:11:24.146
be made here.

205
00:11:24.146 --> 00:11:29.511
This partner section lives, and
this is the same with competitors.

206
00:11:29.511 --> 00:11:31.917
If we go to Opportunities,

207
00:11:31.917 --> 00:11:37.469
it's not the same place that you
would find in the field setup.

208
00:11:37.469 --> 00:11:42.002
But you're actually gonna find it
in its own optimist section here.

209
00:11:42.002 --> 00:11:43.965
So you're gonna click Competitors.

210
00:11:43.965 --> 00:11:48.222
And this just one place to make those
changes to the picklist of values.

211
00:11:48.222 --> 00:11:51.581
Same if we go back over here
into the opportunity list,

212
00:11:51.581 --> 00:11:53.290
where would you find that?

213
00:11:53.290 --> 00:11:56.778
So long list here, we're looking for

214
00:11:56.778 --> 00:12:01.154
partners, and Might be missing it here.

215
00:12:01.154 --> 00:12:02.113
[LAUGH]
>> [LAUGH]

216
00:12:02.113 --> 00:12:02.973
>> So this is just

217
00:12:02.973 --> 00:12:06.919
kind of your holding tank to make
changes to some of those values,

218
00:12:06.919 --> 00:12:09.227
some of those picklist values there.

219
00:12:09.227 --> 00:12:12.183
So it's not living just
in the field list here.

220
00:12:12.183 --> 00:12:16.733
But as I'm here, I wanna show you another
cool option which is the sales process and

221
00:12:16.733 --> 00:12:18.225
the big deal alerts.

222
00:12:18.225 --> 00:12:22.730
So your sales processes, and
I'll let that navigate here.

223
00:12:23.980 --> 00:12:27.617
You may have different aspects or
sales processes or

224
00:12:27.617 --> 00:12:31.180
stages that are different for
each sales process.

225
00:12:31.180 --> 00:12:33.834
So maybe for your B2B side of the company,

226
00:12:33.834 --> 00:12:38.209
they have a different sales process
than your B2C side of the things.

227
00:12:38.209 --> 00:12:41.079
So you want to create a sales process.

228
00:12:41.079 --> 00:12:44.393
And you'll have your record
types first created for

229
00:12:44.393 --> 00:12:48.620
the opportunity to kind of associate
these different processes.

230
00:12:48.620 --> 00:12:51.990
Because maybe you don't want
them to follow the same or

231
00:12:51.990 --> 00:12:55.710
collect the same data, so
you'll want to create this beforehand.

232
00:12:55.710 --> 00:12:58.160
This way, you can segment
the two different processes or

233
00:12:58.160 --> 00:13:01.040
you can have multiple, so
you're not limited in just two.

234
00:13:01.040 --> 00:13:05.009
And then another great feature
would be the big deal alert, so

235
00:13:05.009 --> 00:13:07.537
this is useful for any sales managers.

236
00:13:07.537 --> 00:13:10.449
You can select and have a different alert.

237
00:13:10.449 --> 00:13:14.657
Based off the threshold amount that
you define to be notified when

238
00:13:14.657 --> 00:13:16.778
an opportunity amount hits.

239
00:13:16.778 --> 00:13:21.700
Maybe it's a million dollars, or
any amount that you defined here.

240
00:13:21.700 --> 00:13:25.440
And this will,
you have the alert settings,

241
00:13:25.440 --> 00:13:29.690
notify you via email that, hey,
keep an eye on this deal here.

242
00:13:29.690 --> 00:13:31.700
This is a big deal.

243
00:13:31.700 --> 00:13:35.300
You have the option of notifying
the owner of the opportunity.

244
00:13:35.300 --> 00:13:39.017
You can select the recipients
that receive this notification.

245
00:13:39.017 --> 00:13:43.542
And so this is just to kind of show you
some of the automation that you can do for

246
00:13:43.542 --> 00:13:45.971
the opportunity object in Salesforce.

247
00:13:49.726 --> 00:13:53.597
So this is where you enter the threshold,
the amount, and

248
00:13:53.597 --> 00:13:56.051
the probability that's tied to it.

249
00:13:56.051 --> 00:13:58.622
And then whether these
settings are active or not.

250
00:13:58.622 --> 00:14:02.590
But you can see here, all of these fields
highlighted in red are required fields.

251
00:14:05.075 --> 00:14:10.707
If I take us back to the homepage, another
feature that you'll see are the reports.

252
00:14:10.707 --> 00:14:12.382
So you have the options here.

253
00:14:12.382 --> 00:14:16.585
Salesforce gives you out the box
a list of standardized reports.

254
00:14:16.585 --> 00:14:21.145
But this is a great way for
any sales managers to see,

255
00:14:21.145 --> 00:14:24.160
what are my stock opportunities?

256
00:14:24.160 --> 00:14:26.441
What does my pipeline look like?

257
00:14:26.441 --> 00:14:28.745
And you can customize that even further.

258
00:14:28.745 --> 00:14:32.815
But if you were just to use out
the door Salesforce today you

259
00:14:32.815 --> 00:14:37.410
can go straight into these profiles
that are pre-built for you.

260
00:14:37.410 --> 00:14:39.230
So you will see, and I'm sorry,

261
00:14:39.230 --> 00:14:42.419
reports that this takes me
into my opportunity pipeline.

262
00:14:42.419 --> 00:14:48.755
And it's looking at the sales stages
that are already set up by Salesforce.

263
00:14:48.755 --> 00:14:51.902
And breaking it up by the user and
the amounts.

264
00:14:51.902 --> 00:14:56.713
So you have visibility into the pipeline
straight from your Opportunities homepage.

265
00:14:56.713 --> 00:14:59.920
If I navigate back the same thing
if I wanted to go into stock for

266
00:14:59.920 --> 00:15:01.720
opportunities that have closed.

267
00:15:04.240 --> 00:15:06.730
And one more kind of tip
that I will suggest for

268
00:15:06.730 --> 00:15:10.600
any admins that are importing data.

269
00:15:10.600 --> 00:15:16.650
I've seen and set up a lot for
historical retail clients.

270
00:15:16.650 --> 00:15:18.427
It doesn't make a good fit.

271
00:15:18.427 --> 00:15:23.707
Or they don't understand how
an opportunity can work for past orders.

272
00:15:23.707 --> 00:15:28.520
But you can place them into Salesforce and
give them a stage of closed one.

273
00:15:28.520 --> 00:15:35.755
For any historical accounts that have been
completed or fulfilled in Salesforce.

274
00:15:35.755 --> 00:15:38.118
And then that's your way of segmenting and

275
00:15:38.118 --> 00:15:41.803
being able to determine all my
closed sales or won opportunities.

276
00:15:41.803 --> 00:15:44.587
From any of the new ones that
we're trying to keep track of.

277
00:15:44.587 --> 00:15:47.200
Or include into our pipeline.

278
00:15:49.696 --> 00:15:51.959
And then lastly we have
the quarterly summary here.

279
00:15:51.959 --> 00:15:55.739
So you have more control into that
report that you're trying to generate.

280
00:15:55.739 --> 00:15:58.202
You can always go to
the reports section but

281
00:15:58.202 --> 00:16:01.425
Again we are trying to avoid
as many clicks as possible.

282
00:16:01.425 --> 00:16:04.172
And if you can do it
directly from your homepage,

283
00:16:04.172 --> 00:16:08.193
why not have those custom links
here,that you can continue to add to and

284
00:16:08.193 --> 00:16:12.842
run your report from your,the homepage,
from the page you are already going to.

285
00:16:12.842 --> 00:16:17.010
So this was kind of
a neat feature that you.

286
00:16:17.010 --> 00:16:18.165
Outbox.

287
00:16:18.165 --> 00:16:21.830
>> Now Felicia is there a way that we can
track contacts that are associated with

288
00:16:21.830 --> 00:16:23.610
these opportunities?

289
00:16:23.610 --> 00:16:25.490
>> Yes, great question.

290
00:16:25.490 --> 00:16:27.900
Let's go over into the opportunity
record again itself,

291
00:16:27.900 --> 00:16:29.910
so I can show you something that I missed.

292
00:16:29.910 --> 00:16:31.100
Contact Roles.

293
00:16:31.100 --> 00:16:35.620
So Contact Roles is
a great place to associate

294
00:16:35.620 --> 00:16:39.170
contacts that are related to
the account to the opportunity.

295
00:16:39.170 --> 00:16:44.150
So, maybe I have multiple contacts that
are related to this one given opportunity.

296
00:16:44.150 --> 00:16:48.644
And that's a great way to show, if you
have different sales reps working in along

297
00:16:48.644 --> 00:16:53.006
this one large account, let's use Apple
as an example, and you have multiple

298
00:16:53.006 --> 00:16:57.238
opportunities running, there's always
gonna be somebody different, or

299
00:16:57.238 --> 00:17:01.098
teams of people within that account
associated to the opportunity.

300
00:17:01.098 --> 00:17:06.003
So all you do is navigate to the specific
opportunity where these contacts can

301
00:17:06.003 --> 00:17:08.410
be related and select New.

302
00:17:08.410 --> 00:17:11.412
And so what I was originally
looking to show you were,

303
00:17:11.412 --> 00:17:13.694
instead of partners were the contacts.

304
00:17:13.694 --> 00:17:16.170
So we're gonna set Betty as a primary.

305
00:17:16.170 --> 00:17:18.360
Because she's what we
started this account with.

306
00:17:18.360 --> 00:17:19.730
And then we're gonna select.

307
00:17:19.730 --> 00:17:27.460
And I don't think we have multiple
contacts, but let's use Justin.

308
00:17:27.460 --> 00:17:29.650
He'll maybe be associated somewhere else.

309
00:17:29.650 --> 00:17:31.540
And he is the decision maker.

310
00:17:31.540 --> 00:17:35.890
So, I know, maybe as a sales manager,
going into this opportunity.

311
00:17:35.890 --> 00:17:40.526
Okay, I wanna talk to decision
maker rather than the influencer.

312
00:17:40.526 --> 00:17:43.298
And you can see here that
within all these rolls,

313
00:17:43.298 --> 00:17:46.690
these can be changed in the same
area that I showed earlier.

314
00:17:47.740 --> 00:17:51.260
And I can add multiple users here,
I am just gonna add two to show you.

315
00:17:51.260 --> 00:17:56.210
And now in this opportunity from
American Bank, I can scroll down and

316
00:17:56.210 --> 00:18:00.262
see okay, there are different contact
roles related to this opportunity.

317
00:18:00.262 --> 00:18:03.019
I wanna contact the decision maker.

318
00:18:03.019 --> 00:18:04.442
This is his contact information, here.

319
00:18:04.442 --> 00:18:07.890
and it's just gonna pull in everything
that lives within their contact record.

320
00:18:09.270 --> 00:18:11.950
Again, to show you,
you're gonna go to setup.

321
00:18:11.950 --> 00:18:14.280
And we're gonna go to the opportunity.

322
00:18:16.779 --> 00:18:18.290
And, as you can see here,
it's a long list.

323
00:18:18.290 --> 00:18:21.000
So this is what I was originally
looking for is the contact roles and

324
00:18:21.000 --> 00:18:22.400
opportunities here.

325
00:18:22.400 --> 00:18:28.000
And this is where you deactivate, edit,
delete, or even create new values here.

326
00:18:29.750 --> 00:18:33.260
One last thing that I'd like to
point out are the opportunity teams.

327
00:18:34.390 --> 00:18:39.340
Similar to the account teams,
you can have different users associated to

328
00:18:39.340 --> 00:18:43.440
this one opportunity that you wanna
allow access to, for this record.

329
00:18:43.440 --> 00:18:45.900
Maybe someone needs to read,
or see the data.

330
00:18:45.900 --> 00:18:50.210
You wanna go into, wanna enable it.

331
00:18:50.210 --> 00:18:55.060
And separate from the account teams
that we discussed in our last episode.

332
00:18:55.060 --> 00:18:59.302
Opportunity teams is only related
to just the opportunity itself.

333
00:18:59.302 --> 00:19:04.150
So, not the accounts and
any other contracts related to it.

334
00:19:04.150 --> 00:19:09.215
So, if we search for opportunity.

335
00:19:09.215 --> 00:19:12.013
Now we're gonna go to, let's see.

336
00:19:19.339 --> 00:19:21.270
Right here, missed it right underneath.

337
00:19:21.270 --> 00:19:23.500
So, it's not gonna live
within the opportunities.

338
00:19:23.500 --> 00:19:25.598
Another sub-section of opportunities.

339
00:19:25.598 --> 00:19:26.291
This happens often.

340
00:19:26.291 --> 00:19:29.054
>> [LAUGH]
>> Cuz there's a lot to work in within

341
00:19:29.054 --> 00:19:30.390
the Salesforce system.

342
00:19:30.390 --> 00:19:32.960
And just like the account teams,
you need to enable it.

343
00:19:32.960 --> 00:19:33.720
That's the first step.

344
00:19:34.820 --> 00:19:37.940
So I'm gonna enable Team Selling,
is what it's often referred to.

345
00:19:38.950 --> 00:19:40.760
Right now,
these are the four page layouts,

346
00:19:40.760 --> 00:19:42.380
we're still supposed to create C U.

347
00:19:42.380 --> 00:19:48.054
Do you only need it for
sales users, support users.

348
00:19:48.054 --> 00:19:51.890
And again, the layouts are tied to
the different record types as well.

349
00:19:51.890 --> 00:19:55.500
And then we're gonna go ahead, and
last time we had already added it,

350
00:19:55.500 --> 00:19:57.370
but I'm not gonna add it this time.

351
00:19:57.370 --> 00:19:58.765
Just to show you the drag and drop.

352
00:19:58.765 --> 00:20:02.839
And Opportunity Teams.

353
00:20:02.839 --> 00:20:07.097
So now as we go into the same record,
I'm gonna scroll and

354
00:20:07.097 --> 00:20:09.504
look at all of our related list.

355
00:20:09.504 --> 00:20:13.570
And we actually have this
here to add your team role.

356
00:20:13.570 --> 00:20:14.510
What is a role?

357
00:20:14.510 --> 00:20:17.250
This is our executive sponsor for

358
00:20:17.250 --> 00:20:21.250
this opportunity,
this is a sales manager, sales rep.

359
00:20:21.250 --> 00:20:25.480
Me being the record owner, or
maybe me having access to this record

360
00:20:25.480 --> 00:20:29.770
because of a role hierarchy, or somewhere
where I sit along that hierarchy.

361
00:20:29.770 --> 00:20:35.570
Again, anyone with access to this,
can go in, if this is enabled,

362
00:20:35.570 --> 00:20:41.060
and add a user and
give them the read/write access, here.

363
00:20:41.060 --> 00:20:42.610
>> All right, fantastic, Felicia.

364
00:20:42.610 --> 00:20:45.520
Great look there,
at opportunities within Salesforce.

365
00:20:45.520 --> 00:20:48.123
What they are, and
what we can do with those.

366
00:20:48.123 --> 00:20:49.290
We thank you for that.

367
00:20:49.290 --> 00:20:51.600
We hope everybody out there
enjoyed watching this one.

368
00:20:51.600 --> 00:20:52.710
Signing off for ITPRO.TV.

369
00:20:52.710 --> 00:20:54.590
I've been your host, Mike Rodrick.

370
00:20:54.590 --> 00:20:55.372
>> I'm Felicia Duarte.

371
00:20:55.372 --> 00:20:56.530
>> And we'll see you next time.

372
00:20:56.530 --> 00:21:04.361
[MUSIC]

373
00:21:04.361 --> 00:21:08.639
>> Thank you for watching ITPRO.TV.

episodes.description: In this episode, Felicia and Mike continue their look at opportunities in Salesforce. They demonstrate creating opportunity teams and look at defining products within opportunities and using price books.
episodes.title: Opportunities Part 2
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.016 --> 00:00:01.388
Welcome to ITPro.TV.

2
00:00:01.388 --> 00:00:02.510
I'm your host, Don Pezet.

3
00:00:02.510 --> 00:00:06.525
[CROSSTALK]

4
00:00:06.525 --> 00:00:08.350
[MUSIC]

5
00:00:08.350 --> 00:00:12.365
>> You're watching ITPro.TV.

6
00:00:12.365 --> 00:00:12.895
>> Hello.

7
00:00:12.895 --> 00:00:16.258
Welcome to another exciting
episode here at ITPro.TV.

8
00:00:16.258 --> 00:00:17.676
I'm your host Mike Rodrick and

9
00:00:17.676 --> 00:00:20.578
today we're doing our
Salesforce Certified Administrator.

10
00:00:20.578 --> 00:00:24.818
In this episode we're actually continuing
our thought process on opportunities.

11
00:00:24.818 --> 00:00:29.513
We're gonna take a look at the way we can
associate opportunities with products and

12
00:00:29.513 --> 00:00:31.065
prices, and price books.

13
00:00:31.065 --> 00:00:33.785
And here to help us with
that is Miss Felicia Duarte.

14
00:00:33.785 --> 00:00:34.900
Welcome, Felicia.

15
00:00:34.900 --> 00:00:35.837
>> Great, thank you.

16
00:00:35.837 --> 00:00:39.857
So in today's episode I want to carry
on the conversation of opportunities.

17
00:00:39.857 --> 00:00:44.450
And then associating products to
opportunities, how do you do that?

18
00:00:44.450 --> 00:00:48.470
What do I do if I have tiered pricing for
my products?

19
00:00:48.470 --> 00:00:50.860
So, I'm gonna show you
the associations today.

20
00:00:50.860 --> 00:00:53.140
But to start, I do wanna pick up and

21
00:00:53.140 --> 00:00:57.830
show you, one more thing in creating an
opportunity and how to make those private.

22
00:00:57.830 --> 00:01:02.743
So, you do have the option as you go into
an opportunity record to have private

23
00:01:02.743 --> 00:01:03.886
opportunities.

24
00:01:03.886 --> 00:01:06.737
And so, that means maybe there's
a list of opportunities.

25
00:01:06.737 --> 00:01:09.842
That maybe by the sharing or
security defaults,

26
00:01:09.842 --> 00:01:12.048
someone might have access to you.

27
00:01:12.048 --> 00:01:15.959
Or you want to create your own,
that necessarily needs to be private.

28
00:01:15.959 --> 00:01:18.324
So if you make that accessible,

29
00:01:18.324 --> 00:01:23.943
all you have to simply do is check off
Private within Salesforce [INAUDIBLE].

30
00:01:23.943 --> 00:01:26.485
If you go back over into
your home page here,

31
00:01:26.485 --> 00:01:30.620
you can see a list of all of your
opportunities that are marked Private.

32
00:01:31.860 --> 00:01:35.360
Right now we don't have any but
that goes to show you in a list view.

33
00:01:35.360 --> 00:01:39.090
What are some of the standard list
views that Salesforce gives you?

34
00:01:39.090 --> 00:01:41.990
These are the ones that
we suggest on having.

35
00:01:41.990 --> 00:01:44.359
So private opportunities, your pipeline.

36
00:01:45.550 --> 00:01:51.051
New opportunities that were created,
stock opportunities is also a great one.

37
00:01:51.051 --> 00:01:57.500
So, that's just taking it back there but
now let's get into associating products.

38
00:01:57.500 --> 00:02:02.263
So, in my last episode I said for
anything that you wanna hold detail in

39
00:02:02.263 --> 00:02:06.891
your opportunity, you leave that
in the opportunity page layout.

40
00:02:06.891 --> 00:02:12.227
But when you're associating products that
you wanna keep track of or report on.

41
00:02:12.227 --> 00:02:16.315
You wanna have them live in its own
line item, which is considered Products.

42
00:02:16.315 --> 00:02:18.717
So I moved up here, Products.

43
00:02:18.717 --> 00:02:23.483
It was not originally on the layouts
that we were using up into the tabs.

44
00:02:23.483 --> 00:02:28.250
Because this is for maybe anyone
who's within a retail industry.

45
00:02:28.250 --> 00:02:30.730
I just think of that as being
the one I see the most often,

46
00:02:30.730 --> 00:02:34.160
or anyone who provides
any type of service.

47
00:02:34.160 --> 00:02:38.040
You may need to navigate quickly to
your products or see a list of them.

48
00:02:38.040 --> 00:02:40.420
So I brought that up here,
in that instance.

49
00:02:40.420 --> 00:02:42.690
And in Price Books as well,
which we'll cover next.

50
00:02:42.690 --> 00:02:47.232
So let's go into an existing
opportunity that Salesforce has, so

51
00:02:47.232 --> 00:02:50.570
Burlington Textiles
Weaving Plant Generator.

52
00:02:50.570 --> 00:02:51.592
Long word.

53
00:02:51.592 --> 00:02:52.328
[LAUGH]
>> [LAUGH]

54
00:02:52.328 --> 00:02:53.436
>> But right now we can

55
00:02:53.436 --> 00:02:57.740
see within this opportunity I see
an order number, current generators.

56
00:02:57.740 --> 00:03:00.980
This here is just a text field.

57
00:03:00.980 --> 00:03:05.670
If there's a tracking number that I wanna
relate specific to this opportunity,

58
00:03:05.670 --> 00:03:09.230
this can live here, but
what about the details of a record?

59
00:03:09.230 --> 00:03:12.270
What about the products within it?

60
00:03:12.270 --> 00:03:16.240
What if, and I have some instances
where different products are being

61
00:03:16.240 --> 00:03:21.310
fulfilled at different times within
the same opportunity or order.

62
00:03:21.310 --> 00:03:26.300
So, that information will need
to live within its own product.

63
00:03:26.300 --> 00:03:29.350
First, if I select Add Product.

64
00:03:29.350 --> 00:03:33.670
Great, so here we have the selection
to add products to this opportunity.

65
00:03:33.670 --> 00:03:36.790
So, if I want to select
these two products here,

66
00:03:36.790 --> 00:03:39.870
what we're looking at is
a list of the products.

67
00:03:39.870 --> 00:03:42.380
We can see the product code,

68
00:03:42.380 --> 00:03:47.580
the list price, if there was a description
or if it belonged to a product family.

69
00:03:47.580 --> 00:03:49.080
Those details would live here.

70
00:03:49.080 --> 00:03:53.830
But right now I just wanna select
these three products here.

71
00:03:53.830 --> 00:03:55.730
And they do look similar.

72
00:03:55.730 --> 00:04:00.386
GenWatt Diesel 100 versus
GenWatt Diesel 10.

73
00:04:00.386 --> 00:04:04.144
You wanna have your products
separated if there is

74
00:04:04.144 --> 00:04:08.896
a different price maybe by the quantity or
the amount ordered.

75
00:04:08.896 --> 00:04:14.104
So this is a good example on how
to start creating the products.

76
00:04:14.104 --> 00:04:18.280
And this is gonna matter and it's
gonna look similar to a lot of DBSync,

77
00:04:18.280 --> 00:04:19.891
QuickBooks connections.

78
00:04:19.891 --> 00:04:24.360
That you want your products to ultimately
match if you are gonna do some sort of

79
00:04:24.360 --> 00:04:26.240
integration with accounting.

80
00:04:26.240 --> 00:04:31.215
So this is a great example that Salesforce
gives you on how to set up your products.

81
00:04:31.215 --> 00:04:36.896
So right now we're gonna
select these two and

82
00:04:36.896 --> 00:04:39.895
I'm go and hit Select.

83
00:04:39.895 --> 00:04:42.160
[LAUGH] The very top of my page here.

84
00:04:44.010 --> 00:04:47.490
So at this point, for this product,
what is the quantity?

85
00:04:47.490 --> 00:04:49.570
So this is the sales
price that you have here.

86
00:04:49.570 --> 00:04:53.370
I'm just gonna select 1, 5, and 5.

87
00:04:53.370 --> 00:04:57.240
And those highlighted in red,
those are the required fields,

88
00:04:57.240 --> 00:04:58.270
the fields you have to enter.

89
00:04:58.270 --> 00:05:00.200
It has to have a sales price.

90
00:05:00.200 --> 00:05:01.670
Another thing important to know,

91
00:05:01.670 --> 00:05:06.350
you can't have $0 as your price,
it has to be an amount greater than 0.

92
00:05:06.350 --> 00:05:10.490
The date, if you wanted to enter,
and line description.

93
00:05:10.490 --> 00:05:13.050
So I'm gonna go ahead and select Save.

94
00:05:13.050 --> 00:05:17.850
These are just the details at this point
that I have right now in this product.

95
00:05:17.850 --> 00:05:24.529
And each of those are considered
opportunity product line items.

96
00:05:24.529 --> 00:05:27.297
So these are the products
you can see here.

97
00:05:27.297 --> 00:05:31.050
This is the one quantity,
this is the sales price for this.

98
00:05:31.050 --> 00:05:34.440
And what Salesforce will do is
it will take that amount and

99
00:05:34.440 --> 00:05:38.560
it will automatically update
the Amount field here for you.

100
00:05:38.560 --> 00:05:42.641
So you can see here within your
opportunity, this is now locked.

101
00:05:42.641 --> 00:05:47.837
Once you add products to the opportunity
it's gonna auto calculate that for

102
00:05:47.837 --> 00:05:49.306
you and lock it down.

103
00:05:49.306 --> 00:05:52.883
So, it's taking in the quantity
times the sales price and

104
00:05:52.883 --> 00:05:55.800
adding all these products together.

105
00:05:55.800 --> 00:05:57.970
So, if I wanted to select,

106
00:05:57.970 --> 00:06:02.300
let's say we have an example of
customers that have tiered pricing.

107
00:06:02.300 --> 00:06:06.350
Maybe you have some customers that fall
under your gold, or your bronze, or

108
00:06:06.350 --> 00:06:09.250
aggressive versus standard pricing.

109
00:06:09.250 --> 00:06:12.820
You want to have a list
of all your products and

110
00:06:12.820 --> 00:06:15.780
be able to break down those
different prices per product.

111
00:06:15.780 --> 00:06:18.700
So you're gonna wanna create a price book.

112
00:06:19.970 --> 00:06:22.520
So, think of this as
your master price list.

113
00:06:22.520 --> 00:06:26.610
Right now,
Salesforce gives you standard price book.

114
00:06:26.610 --> 00:06:28.250
And this is taking in all the products.

115
00:06:28.250 --> 00:06:32.100
Right now we're gonna see a list of all
the products that Salesforce created

116
00:06:32.100 --> 00:06:34.170
just for this developer edition.

117
00:06:34.170 --> 00:06:38.051
And if I hit Go To List I'm
in my standard price book and

118
00:06:38.051 --> 00:06:42.645
these are a list of all my products
with what that list price is.

119
00:06:42.645 --> 00:06:46.447
So let's say I wanna add,
and I'm gonna hit back,

120
00:06:46.447 --> 00:06:49.875
I wanna add a different price book.

121
00:06:49.875 --> 00:06:54.380
So if we need to make changes to
the standard price book, I can do so here.

122
00:06:54.380 --> 00:06:57.503
But this is the only active
price book at this moment.

123
00:06:57.503 --> 00:07:02.375
So let's go back into the Price Book
homepage, and select New.

124
00:07:02.375 --> 00:07:08.007
So let's call this one Aggressive.

125
00:07:08.007 --> 00:07:11.175
And if there was a description
feel free to enter a description.

126
00:07:11.175 --> 00:07:13.671
Of course, the more details often,
the better.

127
00:07:13.671 --> 00:07:15.776
And I want to get this
started right away so

128
00:07:15.776 --> 00:07:18.191
I'm going to make it
active at this point here.

129
00:07:18.191 --> 00:07:22.079
Is there an existing price book
that I want to clone from?

130
00:07:22.079 --> 00:07:24.420
So I can use Standard,
or standard price book.

131
00:07:25.670 --> 00:07:28.898
These are the existing price books
that we have right now, and hit Save.

132
00:07:28.898 --> 00:07:31.372
So it's going to pull in
all those details for

133
00:07:31.372 --> 00:07:34.030
this new price book that we've created.

134
00:07:34.030 --> 00:07:35.910
It's adding all the products already.

135
00:07:35.910 --> 00:07:38.440
The products have to be active.

136
00:07:38.440 --> 00:07:43.113
And in order for this price book to show
up when you're creating opportunities.

137
00:07:43.113 --> 00:07:46.722
The price book and products within it,
they all have to be active.

138
00:07:46.722 --> 00:07:51.577
And at least one product has to be
associated to a price book in order to

139
00:07:51.577 --> 00:07:52.761
make it active.

140
00:07:52.761 --> 00:07:57.738
So if you started backwards and you didn't
use or have any products existing first,

141
00:07:57.738 --> 00:08:00.345
price book won't matter at this point yet.

142
00:08:00.345 --> 00:08:04.950
So, within this price book
you can make changes here.

143
00:08:04.950 --> 00:08:08.050
But if you go within the price book
that we're in, so we're in Aggressive.

144
00:08:08.050 --> 00:08:10.895
You see all the products here.

145
00:08:10.895 --> 00:08:15.017
You can certainly add at this point if
there were new products that only lived in

146
00:08:15.017 --> 00:08:16.776
one price book and not the other.

147
00:08:16.776 --> 00:08:21.670
But you can make changes at this
point here to the line items.

148
00:08:21.670 --> 00:08:23.630
So, for this one in this price book.

149
00:08:23.630 --> 00:08:26.624
We can see here aggressive,
so we know where we're at.

150
00:08:26.624 --> 00:08:33.049
We can see for which product, what is the
list price, what is the standard price?

151
00:08:33.049 --> 00:08:36.864
This is standard prices pulling
in from that master price book.

152
00:08:36.864 --> 00:08:40.079
And then the list price is how it
changes in the multiple price books that

153
00:08:40.079 --> 00:08:40.760
you can have.

154
00:08:40.760 --> 00:08:44.730
So this way when you go
back into an opportunity,

155
00:08:46.260 --> 00:08:49.680
let's go into one that we do not
have products associated to it.

156
00:08:51.620 --> 00:08:56.675
You can say, and you can only select one
price book for one given opportunity.

157
00:08:56.675 --> 00:09:01.847
So you can't select different
price books for one opportunity.

158
00:09:01.847 --> 00:09:06.646
So you want to select Choose Price Book.

159
00:09:06.646 --> 00:09:11.718
And this is for an aggressive sale.

160
00:09:11.718 --> 00:09:18.750
So maybe my prices are little more
aggressive than my standard price book.

161
00:09:18.750 --> 00:09:22.126
So now we can see here
what price book we are in.

162
00:09:22.126 --> 00:09:26.908
And as we select products, it's only
gonna pull from that price book here,

163
00:09:26.908 --> 00:09:30.140
with those prices that we edited and
made changes.

164
00:09:30.140 --> 00:09:34.504
So that's going to show you
the relationship between tiered pricing,

165
00:09:34.504 --> 00:09:37.352
products, associating them to price books.

166
00:09:37.352 --> 00:09:41.976
And then keep in mind, as we go into
in the future episodes, data import.

167
00:09:41.976 --> 00:09:47.790
It is a three-step import process if
you do want to import price books and

168
00:09:47.790 --> 00:09:48.755
products.

169
00:09:48.755 --> 00:09:52.568
With that example, and
associate them to opportunities.

170
00:09:52.568 --> 00:09:56.172
So now when you go into an opportunity and

171
00:09:56.172 --> 00:10:00.839
you wanna generate a report
off of all the products.

172
00:10:00.839 --> 00:10:03.629
You are able to collect the data and
have line items and

173
00:10:03.629 --> 00:10:06.426
you can have custom fields
live within the products.

174
00:10:06.426 --> 00:10:09.063
You can have formula fields
within those products.

175
00:10:09.063 --> 00:10:13.347
And we have seen a lot of custom
development using opportunities and

176
00:10:13.347 --> 00:10:15.912
opportunity line items with products.

177
00:10:15.912 --> 00:10:21.475
Rather than just a standard large text
field of data within the opportunity.

178
00:10:21.475 --> 00:10:26.736
You can get pretty granular in your
reporting when you break it up this way.

179
00:10:26.736 --> 00:10:31.553
And it's a two step process when
you do have to add products.

180
00:10:31.553 --> 00:10:36.600
But it's the best way and
the right way to report on your products.

181
00:10:38.070 --> 00:10:38.730
>> All right, Felicia.

182
00:10:38.730 --> 00:10:40.060
Fantastic stuff, there.

183
00:10:40.060 --> 00:10:43.206
And that's one of the places I think I see
a lot of people struggle with sometimes,

184
00:10:43.206 --> 00:10:44.295
or organizations.

185
00:10:44.295 --> 00:10:47.810
They'll have different price points for
different customers.

186
00:10:47.810 --> 00:10:50.000
But then nobody seems
to be on the same page.

187
00:10:50.000 --> 00:10:51.400
So now, with a different price list,

188
00:10:51.400 --> 00:10:54.240
we can make sure that everybody
is on that same page.

189
00:10:54.240 --> 00:10:54.930
When we say, okay.

190
00:10:54.930 --> 00:10:56.230
We're going to go with an aggressive sale.

191
00:10:56.230 --> 00:10:58.040
Well, what what was our price for that?

192
00:10:58.040 --> 00:10:59.219
Well now we all know.

193
00:10:59.219 --> 00:11:02.562
So fantastic, we appreciate that look
at opportunities and price books.

194
00:11:02.562 --> 00:11:05.443
And how we can differentiate different
prices for different customers.

195
00:11:05.443 --> 00:11:06.350
So we appreciate that.

196
00:11:06.350 --> 00:11:08.018
Hope everybody out there enjoyed watching.

197
00:11:08.018 --> 00:11:11.242
Signing off for ITPro.TV,
I've been your host Mike Rodrick.

198
00:11:11.242 --> 00:11:12.218
>> And I'm Felicia Duarte.

199
00:11:12.218 --> 00:11:15.354
>> And we'll see you next time.

200
00:11:15.354 --> 00:11:21.266
[MUSIC]

201
00:11:21.266 --> 00:11:25.454
Thank you for watching ITPRO.TV.

episodes.description: In this episode, Felicia and Mike discuss the architecture and relationship model of Salesforce objects. They look at master detail relationships and lookup relationships.
episodes.title: Standard and Custom Objects
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.270 --> 00:00:06.297
Welcome to ITProTV, I'm your host, Don-
>> [CROSSTALK]

2
00:00:06.297 --> 00:00:08.401
[MUSIC]

3
00:00:08.401 --> 00:00:12.610
>> You're watching ITProTV.

4
00:00:12.610 --> 00:00:15.400
>> Hello, welcome to another
exciting episode here at ITProTV.

5
00:00:15.400 --> 00:00:17.530
I'm your host Mike Rodrick, and

6
00:00:17.530 --> 00:00:20.050
today we're doing our Salesforce
certified administrator.

7
00:00:20.050 --> 00:00:23.860
And in this episode,
we're gonna be looking at standard and

8
00:00:23.860 --> 00:00:27.330
custom objects within
the Salesforce platform.

9
00:00:27.330 --> 00:00:30.570
And here to explain those to
us is Miss Felicia Duarte.

10
00:00:30.570 --> 00:00:31.780
Welcome back, Felicia.

11
00:00:31.780 --> 00:00:35.310
>> Great, I'm happy to go
over the largest chunk that

12
00:00:35.310 --> 00:00:39.280
is covered in the Salesforce
certified admin exam.

13
00:00:39.280 --> 00:00:42.180
And that is standard and custom objects.

14
00:00:42.180 --> 00:00:46.600
So this topic will include everything
from the details of the fields,

15
00:00:46.600 --> 00:00:49.870
creating new fields,
creating a custom object.

16
00:00:49.870 --> 00:00:54.875
I'm gonna get into every single one of the
custom fields that you can create within

17
00:00:54.875 --> 00:00:58.470
Salesforce, because a lot of the questions
pertain to that and what you can do.

18
00:00:58.470 --> 00:01:03.070
The differences between a master detail
relationship and a look up relationship,

19
00:01:03.070 --> 00:01:07.290
how to change pick list values or
what formula fields and

20
00:01:07.290 --> 00:01:10.580
all those different types of fields
that you have when you're creating a new

21
00:01:11.945 --> 00:01:15.115
object or fields within the objects.

22
00:01:15.115 --> 00:01:19.305
So let's get started and then we're gonna
go ahead and start with the opportunities

23
00:01:19.305 --> 00:01:22.765
and just the definition, I'm sorry just
the objects, and just the definition as

24
00:01:22.765 --> 00:01:26.580
a whole is think of your objects which
you'll hear of often as database

25
00:01:26.580 --> 00:01:31.270
tables that can hold some of these records
or groups of records of information.

26
00:01:31.270 --> 00:01:35.670
So we're gonna start with the process
of creating a new custom object.

27
00:01:35.670 --> 00:01:38.700
So what we've discovered
in some of our previous

28
00:01:38.700 --> 00:01:40.260
episodes is everything you see up here.

29
00:01:40.260 --> 00:01:42.420
Those are standard Salesforce objects.

30
00:01:42.420 --> 00:01:45.140
We have yet
to create in any episode a new object.

31
00:01:45.140 --> 00:01:47.070
So let's go ahead and do that.

32
00:01:47.070 --> 00:01:49.180
From our set up button.

33
00:01:49.180 --> 00:01:52.760
So I'm gonna create, and this is
going to live in a different section

34
00:01:52.760 --> 00:01:55.450
than what we're used to
navigating to within Salesforce.

35
00:01:55.450 --> 00:02:00.030
So I'm just going to select,
or search for, objects.

36
00:02:00.030 --> 00:02:04.810
And now, that option is going to live
within the create section of Salesforce,

37
00:02:04.810 --> 00:02:08.650
and it's going to live within its
own bucket of custom objects.

38
00:02:08.650 --> 00:02:10.300
So I'm going to select.

39
00:02:10.300 --> 00:02:11.600
New custom object.

40
00:02:12.600 --> 00:02:15.860
I'm gonna use the example,
let's say that we're in a real estate, and

41
00:02:15.860 --> 00:02:18.280
let's use utilized properties.

42
00:02:18.280 --> 00:02:21.150
I want to be able to record data,

43
00:02:21.150 --> 00:02:26.730
just like you would in another database
table of property information.

44
00:02:26.730 --> 00:02:28.110
So what is the label?

45
00:02:28.110 --> 00:02:31.310
What should that look
like at the very top?

46
00:02:31.310 --> 00:02:33.631
So I'm gonna create property.

47
00:02:35.199 --> 00:02:36.770
What is the plural label?

48
00:02:36.770 --> 00:02:37.390
Properties.

49
00:02:38.790 --> 00:02:40.410
Does it start with a vowel sound?

50
00:02:40.410 --> 00:02:41.580
No, it does not.

51
00:02:41.580 --> 00:02:44.950
And if there's a description,
feel free to add the description below.

52
00:02:46.050 --> 00:02:48.240
So, these are the basic details here,

53
00:02:48.240 --> 00:02:51.740
we have the option of opening up a window
using visual force page, if you need to,

54
00:02:51.740 --> 00:02:54.900
if there is more heavy custom
development done and right now,

55
00:02:54.900 --> 00:02:59.330
we're just gonna stick with what
you need to know to pass the exam.

56
00:02:59.330 --> 00:03:02.020
So right now,
we've entered a property name.

57
00:03:02.020 --> 00:03:04.360
This information here is gonna auto fill.

58
00:03:04.360 --> 00:03:06.730
You have two different
types of date types, so,

59
00:03:06.730 --> 00:03:10.450
do you need it to be an auto number,
or a text.

60
00:03:10.450 --> 00:03:11.040
Right now,

61
00:03:11.040 --> 00:03:15.770
if you wanted to give it a property name,
I'm just gonna keep it as a text field.

62
00:03:15.770 --> 00:03:19.940
Or maybe there are instances like
financial account information is

63
00:03:19.940 --> 00:03:24.690
a good example of a object
that may need an auto number

64
00:03:24.690 --> 00:03:27.960
rather than a text field to get started.

65
00:03:27.960 --> 00:03:29.880
So I have the option.

66
00:03:29.880 --> 00:03:34.400
I usually prefer to select most of these
if it's not a junction object which we'll

67
00:03:34.400 --> 00:03:37.960
go through, but
I want to be able to report on this.

68
00:03:37.960 --> 00:03:42.340
I want to be able to keep track of
activities done against the report.

69
00:03:42.340 --> 00:03:44.410
So all of the same features and

70
00:03:44.410 --> 00:03:47.310
functionalities that you can
have with a standard object.

71
00:03:47.310 --> 00:03:49.920
You can have with a custom object.

72
00:03:49.920 --> 00:03:51.630
I want to be able to track field history.

73
00:03:51.630 --> 00:03:54.740
This might be for
property information in this example.

74
00:03:54.740 --> 00:03:58.650
And if we have chatter
enabled I want to allow

75
00:03:58.650 --> 00:04:02.340
access in Chatter groups for
this custom object.

76
00:04:02.340 --> 00:04:04.440
So, we're selecting all those features.

77
00:04:04.440 --> 00:04:08.180
And then this is some information
regarding the API access

78
00:04:08.180 --> 00:04:10.830
if this is something that
you're integrating and using.

79
00:04:10.830 --> 00:04:15.250
Right now we're just going to go to
the other topics here which is deployment.

80
00:04:15.250 --> 00:04:19.430
Yes, I want to deploy it and use it now
and make it available, and then search.

81
00:04:19.430 --> 00:04:23.060
Do you want this, the records and
the data, in here to be searchable?

82
00:04:23.060 --> 00:04:26.130
So I'm gonna select Allow Search and

83
00:04:26.130 --> 00:04:29.960
I want the same functionality
to Add Notes and Attachments.

84
00:04:29.960 --> 00:04:33.560
If this is something you would like
to showcase up here at the very top,

85
00:04:34.560 --> 00:04:38.060
you want to select Launch New Custom Tab.

86
00:04:38.060 --> 00:04:39.630
Otherwise, you're going back in and

87
00:04:39.630 --> 00:04:43.090
doing more clicks than you need to if
you don't select it and you forget.

88
00:04:43.090 --> 00:04:47.860
So i'm just gonna select save, and
what this will do is, because I typed off

89
00:04:47.860 --> 00:04:51.528
that box now it's gonna take me to
the option of creating a new tab.

90
00:04:51.528 --> 00:04:56.940
So every new object that
is displayed up here has to

91
00:04:56.940 --> 00:05:02.040
have the identifier that
tab style associated to it.

92
00:05:02.040 --> 00:05:04.590
So we're going to select tab style.

93
00:05:04.590 --> 00:05:09.360
This is something you have to choose and
all these fine icons to go through and

94
00:05:09.360 --> 00:05:14.715
if we're talking properties, I'm going
to look for maybe a home or the castle.

95
00:05:14.715 --> 00:05:15.735
This one sticks out for me.

96
00:05:16.895 --> 00:05:19.455
Whatever's relevant to the information
you're looking to collect.

97
00:05:19.455 --> 00:05:24.205
And this is just again, your quick way for
your other users to know where to navigate

98
00:05:24.205 --> 00:05:29.435
to when they're in the quick find section
or going to the last places they visited.

99
00:05:29.435 --> 00:05:31.705
So that's going to showcase here.

100
00:05:31.705 --> 00:05:34.390
We don't have any custom
pages to add to it.

101
00:05:34.390 --> 00:05:37.810
